review_content: Had a couple of these Buds with some dinner at Outback. Easy drinking lager, goes nice with a good meal.
Love this beer. Been drinking it since it was in skinny cans. Great calorie to alcohol ratio. Its my goldilocks. Budweiser boats me and bud light is well bud light. Select is just right

This is Budweiser's answer to Coors Light an Miller Lite.  One can't go wrong with it if they're in the mood for a light beer.  It has a crown on the bottle cap because it's in the King of Beers family.

Great way to reduce carbs in a beer. Its rated low because I believe most are comparing it to a full bodied craft beer or even any beer with higher carbs which substantially add to flavor and body.  Relatively high in ABV for a low carb beer. Taste great, less filling. Oh, wait...

Bud Select needs More advertisement on Television. I drank Bud Light all my adult life. Once I tasted Bud Select. Bye Bud Light. I have only two (2) stores in my area. One in different counties. Fortunate for me I live near a county line and both stores are 10 miles away. I have had 3 local taverns stock Bud Select and they only stock a case. They run out fast. My VFW Post has the largest Bud Select Fans Base. They stock 20 cases each delivery. Need more places to buy Bud Select.

I'm doing Keto diet and this is one of the best choices when you crave a beer. To be a light low carb option it's one of the highest Alcohol per volume that you're going to find with a great flavor. So if you're on a diet or keto, this is a 4.0 if you're a regular beer guy or gal then it's like a 2.2

This is one of, if not the best, "light" beers commercially available. It actually has decent flavor. It is not a traditional heavy lager. It is the best low calorie light beer made. Select 55 is water, much like Bud Light and Ultra Light. I also like Rolling Rock Light and Heineken Light. I wish this was more readily available, and I hope they continue to make it.
tasted like trash in a bottle. Budweiser has done a wonderful job of perfecting this.

25 ounce can into lager glass, canned on 8/24/2017. Pours crystal clear medium golden yellow color with a 1 finger fairly dense and rocky white head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of cracker, white bread dough, lightly toasted biscuit, light pepper, and herbal/grassy earthiness. Nice and pleasant aromas with good balance of pale malt and light-moderate earthy hop notes; with solid strength. Taste of cracker, white bread dough, lightly toasted biscuit, light pepper, and herbal/grassy earthiness. Nice robustness and balance of pale malt and light-moderate earthy hop flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance, and zero cloying/astringent flavors after the finish. Fairly crisp/clean finishing. Perfectly clean on lager flavors, with zero yeast notes present. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering bitterness and carbonation. Medium-high carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately bready/grainy, and fairly sticky balanced mouthfeel that is good. A bit thin, but not watery finish. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4.3%. Overall this is a good light lager. All around nice robustness and balance of pale malt and light-moderate earthy hop flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and refreshing to drink. Tastes like a more flavorful version of Bud Light/Regular. Supposedly all malt, and it's noticeable. Clean malts and solid earthy hop balance for the style. Definitely one of the best macro light lagers I've had. A nicely enjoyable offering, and great style example.

I thought "select" usually indicated a better attempt?? Not so with the "king". this is another bad tasting, badly made, poorly created and only able to use their marketing monster to sell. taste should sell beer, not ads with horses in them. Bud doesnt care, they want money, not beer. yuck. avoid this mess.
Micholbe ultra clone with more taste. Basic low calorie beer. cereal, spruce,
Worse than the original. At least the original is non-descript. This one has a stale bread finish.

From Oct 2008

Bought as a single for 95 cents.

A medium yellow colour with a average head of foam that soon shrunk to near nothing.

The smell is the usual for a beer of this style. No need to expound on that, me thinks.

The taste has nothing going on. Everything is lightly done and judging what is there, it's better off that way. Even the slight hop bitterness isn't close to being done right. Mouthfeel? Bad. This *is* an avoid beer if I've ever tasted one.
355ml embossed twist off from the bottle. Flavor is entirely light and inoffensive. A touch of soapy bitterness and tap water aftertaste. 1.25 at bar louie and not woth it.
Bottle, in US. Backlog entry. Entering my historic scores for US beers whilst visiting New York. No tasting notes kept, just rating.
Had a couple of these Buds with some dinner at Outback. Easy drinking lager, goes nice with a good meal.

Worse than the original. At least the original is non-descript. This one has a stale bread finish.
From Oct 2008…
355ml embossed twist off from the bottle. Flavor is entirely light and inoffensive. A touch of soapy bitterness and tap water aftertaste. 1.25 at bar louie and not woth it.
Bottle, in US. Backlog entry. Entering my historic scores for US beers whilst visiting New York. No tasting notes kept, just rating.

On tap. Pours a straw yellow color. About two fingers offwhite head. No lacing, but better than expected retention.

Aroma is cardboard, corn, rice and more rice.

Taste is same. Cardboard and rice. Watery. Not ’bad’ just not flavorful.

Mouthfeel is light, carbonated. Not smooth. Worsens as it warms.

Overall, not bad. Good for what it is. Would not order again. Similar to Michelob Ultra, but Ultra is much better.

Now this is a tasty beverage! Brings back fond memories of my community college days as I stumbled into a 9 am online class 14 minutes late with my pants half down and the taste of my best friends future ex wife still lingering in my mouth - those were the days.....

From a 25floz can (02.22.2017 canned date) bought for $2, and poured into a glass. I consider this a very good light beer. It is clean, crisp, and due to the overall lack of flavor it also lacks off flavors. Not much to look at as it is pale and what head there is quickly subsides. Smells like particle board, but so do many pale lagers. Palate is light tasting like liquid kashi (cereal grains and white rice). I have to say, it is my go to when craft selections are lame, situation appropriate, and best in the macro-light lager class. Oh, I’ve had this on tap and bottle. It tastes consistently the same. The Lays potato chips of beer!
12 oz. bottle at Big Fred’s Pizza, Omaha. Pour was clear golden, small white head. Aroma was barley, grains, cereal. Taste was moderate sweet, watery, cereal grains, barley.

This is more akin to Black Crown than to Bud Light or Budweiser. It is, purportedly, all malt and I actually believe that because it has a hint of caramel color. I suspect they get it so ’light’ by brewing a malt bill that would make Bud Light but without all the rice. The taste is more refined and clearly features a more sophisticated hop selection than the yellow Buds. Overall, very drinkable if not a particularly versatile beer.
had to try was free...basically the same as budweiser just less calories...i just do not like budweiser products...yuck!
Backlog. Pretty similar to bud but with less flavor. They tried but still not as much flavor as Bud and that is saying a lot.
Tastes exactly the same as a Budweiser but less calories woohoo. Pretty much just a standard tasting mass produced lager

Originally rated on 6/16/08. I was out at my towns annual summer celebration and my choices were the select, budweiser, bud light, and miller lite. So when faced with two evils always select the one you never tried. First of all i was gouged on the price but it was hotter than hell, oh well. it went down smooth, not much flavor, watery, standard A.B. mass produced beer. With that said it was better than the other choices if only for the alcohol content.

Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass. The appearance is a clear light yellow color with a thin white head. The aroma is of sweet grain and corn. The taste is grain with some malt, a little watery. Overall, an average beer.

12 oz twist off bottle someone left behind at a party I had earlier in the summer. 12APR15 born on date. The pour is a clear pale golden with a quickly falling white head. The aroma is sweet malt, some honey, all pretty faint. As the beer warmed, some grain. The taste is generically sweet tasting malt, clean through to the finish. The palate is light to thin bodied with soft carbonation, which was softer and easier to drink than Bud Light or Bud. The aftertaste is bit dirty sweet after it warmed.
A darker version of Budweiser, but doesn’t taste much better. This just goes into the pile of other Budweiser products I didn’t care for.
A mass produced light lager with perhaps a dash more of some dark crystal malt to make it "different" than the others?
Crappy beer available at the golf course. Pretty much has no color flavor or aroma. Slightly grainy aftertaste. Really not much there.

This is a watered down version of bud, sort of reminds me of Michelob Ultra or Bud Light. I actually like this a bit better than regular bud because the taste isn’t as strong so somewhat less skunky. The aroma is still semi-skunky, and the appearance is very thin and weak. Looks like pee, a very pale golden-yellow. The flavor is very minimal, mostly water and grain. Not the worst cheap lawnmower beer around.

Look: straw color. Very clear. White head.
Smell: slight flower smell: bready. 
Taste: flowers. Biscuit.
Feel: light beer. Medium carbonation. 
Overall: refreshing beer. Easy drinker. 
First drank: mom & dads 2/8/15
Vintage: oct 21, 2013

Some St. Louis Cardnials fans told me that this is the best beer in America. They also said St. Louis is the best city in America. Smells ok. Like cheap beer. It’s clear and bright yellow. I like that. Seems like it would take some technology to get beer to look so clean. Tastes weird, like bubbles from untreated sewage water. Very light and watery and very carbonated and a weird aftertaste that goes from sour to bitter. This is a terrible, terrible beer. Undrinkable.
"distinct and flavorful" my a@#. is there a real difference between this and bud??? not much, as they are both light american ca-ca. not worth trying again."

Julie never had this beer but if she did she was very much hate this it taste like horrible horrible water down this beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Selected by whom? Pale straw, large white head. Unbalanced malt, no hops or bitterness. A pointless beer.

Draft @ Busch Stadium, St Louis, MO. Pours a clear pale yellow color with a small white head. Had a fruity grainy weak cardboard aroma. Fruity grainy slightly thin watery smooth flavor. Has a fruity grainy watery finish.

Reviewed from notes and had more than enough times to say something about it. It looks like I’ve had this in a pint glass and a pilsener however, there’s nothing that indicates any difference in either glass.
The appearance was almost hazy golden yellow color with a decent transparency to it. Carbonated bubbles rise at a rapid pace.
The smell actually had just a tad more to it than the 55 - perhaps some roasted sweet corn.
The taste was mainly sweet and crisp leading with a clean finish.
The palate sits about a light to medium as it wants to show some backbone but maintains a certain lightness to it. The carbonation is actually crisp and settling, once again its trying to display some sort of actual body to it but doesn’t.
Overall, personally, I think this probably the best stab on the market for a low calorie beer. However, would I have it again? Only if I need to lose weight and I don’t need to lose weight so....I’ll leave it at that. I could actually live with this if I ever got diabetes.

There is not much to say or taste here. It pours very light yellow. The body is very clean and clear with lively carbonation that forms a thick white head. The aroma is light, mostly of rice and hay. There is not a bit of hops anywhere. The flavor is also very light. Mostly of rice, paper and hay, that leads you to a crisp clean finish. Overall its low carbohydrate, low calories and low on flavor.
It does have a clean finish, but I think that’s because there’s just not much in terms of a flavor profile here.
Bottle pour typical light yellow. Nose faint sweet malt, minimal adjunct. Taste very minimal malt up front, Mid palate mineral and off flavors. No finish. Why did I drink this?

Filthy American piss. I can’t believe people actually buy this shite, typical example of corporations trying to reinvent themselves with more of the same rubbish with more expensive marketing. Get stuffed sepo hogwash.

Bottle: Another one that gets tossed around at family picnics & parties quite often. Let’s be honest, it’s the same as all the rest... Grainy with an unpleasant adjunct-driven sweetness, stale hops, & big metallic notes. Sharp, over-carbonated & quite thin. Not the worst thing on the planet, but there really isn’t any reason for you to drink this. Water would be a better choice... Why waste the calories (even if only 99) ?

Gross, now that I've had better. I repent that I've had this beer and I really wish I didn't have to put 75 words or more in the comments.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
(Backlog) Clear yellow, foamy white head. The smell is grainy, weak, rice, and weak. The taste is basically water with some corn and rice mix.

Drank at Boegemans. Pours light color, white head. Not much in flavor or body, but a good choice for drinking high volumes.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I had this at Fridays. Pours a clear yellow with a white head. Taste watery, light, like the other mass produced light beers. I thought was good. I would drink again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Its a top seller where I’m from, can’t complain about the taste. Greasy appearance.
The king of beers does it again ladies and gentleman with an easy to drink lager that is no calories and 4.3% alcohol.
bottle. Pale golden with small head. How many variations of beer flavored water can Budweiser make? This one is especially watery.

If you can imagine drinking water, that’s essentially what this beer is... It’s like drinking corny generic water-beer... It’s not bad, but it’s not good. It’s what I drink when I’m not drinking... And it’s only 99 calories so I can have like 10 of them before I feel like I’m gonna inflate like the blueberry girl from willy wonka...

King capped bottle at a cookout, poured into Styrofoam cup (ain’t I fancy). Clear gold color with white head. Aroma was trying, faint pale malt, bready sweetness, corn and slight skunk note. The "born on date" was May so some age on this one. Taste is the aroma pretty much, maybe even more watery. Light body, heavy carbonation, fizzy with clean finish. Not much bad to say, not anything good either. Just another there light lager product from the big one.

The aroma of this beer is practically nonexistent but does have hints of corn and bread malts, and the appearance is a clear yellow color with a large white head. The taste is practically nothing but does have a touch of sweetness and a touch of sourness. The palate combines a light body, thin texture, soft carbonation, and an abrupt finish.
I actually used to drink this frequently at the baseball park. Can’t handle it now. Pours a clear golden color. Aroma is corn, grain, and a sweet taste. Light body.

One day AB should really try to brew a real beer. I wonder the same about this beer as I wondered about the cafeteria food in school... the food looked pretty "real" when they dropped it off, so what happened to it from the time they dropped it off to the time it was served?
I’ll start copy and pasting these pale lager reviews after this. Just more cardboard and basement-grown hops. If that is even possible.

Can. Pours clear gold with two fimgera of coarse white head. Settles almost immediately with thin, stringy lacing. Aroma is sweet, grain, bread, corn. Flavor is very sweet, cereal, grain, bread. Moderate carbonation, light body, and watery texture. Sweet, grainy, bread in a can, drinkable.

Can. Might have caught me at a weak moment, but had this at a friend’s house and it wasn’t horrid, the world did not end. It just is what it claims to be, sometimes you just have to shut up and drink it.

12oz can, thanks to my cousin Daniel for letting me steal this from his fridge. Date on can reads 31-Aug-12. Clear golden color. Bubbles on the side of the glass. Thin white head. Strong carbonation. Big bite. Light body. Light bitter taste. Big sour bite. Awful stomach acid -like flavor. Really rancid. This can must have really, really gone south. All I could manage was a couple sips before drain-pouring.
Pours yellow gold with white head. nose and taste of corn, light skunk and hints of barley. Mostly water. Bland. Light bodied.
Rice! For a yard/garage lager does a fine job. Look, smell, taste and mouth feel all simple at best. Price point best feature. Rice!
On tap at Houlihan’s in Columbia. Happy hour special, $2 for 20oz. Pours a clear golden yellow color with small white head. Basically the same as Bud Light.

Watered down version of Bud Light. Nothing to see here. Better than Michelob Ultra at least...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Well, It’s not the worst beer I’ve ever had. And that’s about the best thing I can say for it. Watery, a sickeningly sweet-skunky smell, and a bland and off-putting taste.
No smell, almost water appearance, bland taste with no flavors coming forward, could drink many though

Can: 
Very typical American Lager....grains, etc.etc..
It IS, however, much better than regular Budweiser.
More body, more tasre....less offensive.
It’s not really "good" by any means.... but it is fairly drinkable if you absolutely must.

I don’t have anything great to say about this beer. It’s alright, kind of harsh carbonation, but not terrible. No real aroma, kind of low taste, but that’s not surprising for a light beer. Certainly would choose over Natty
Thin, watery, perhaps a bit more aroma/taste/body than Bud Light. Harsh, faintly metallic carbonation. Neutral lager finish. Drinkable

Bottle to pint.  Looks fine for a light macro lager.  Hardly any smell to speak of, and what there is in’t what I’d describe as good.  Tastes like watered down beer with a similar mouthfeel.  Tick tock!
Arguably better than Bud Light, but not too great. I like the idea of the beer, not so much the beer itself
12 oz bottle. Pours a golden color. Actually has flavor considering its a light beer. No body to this beer. You could drink 12 of them and not get full.

It is what it is. Super light beer that attempts to retain some flavor. Don't over think this brew it's light. You can drink 15

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
No improvement on the original, unless you count a better looking label for the bottle.
Probably my favorite Bud brew, only because it does finish cleaner. More tolerable than Bud Light, but that doesn’t say much. Nothing great, but it?s def. the best low carb beer I?ve had.
Can. Highly-consumed cheap beer arond here. Relatively satisfying for its price. Nothing special, just a bit better than the average.

I use ratebeer as a running total of all the beers I have tried. Unfortunately, I did try this crap. I need to get around to getting all these over produced marco craps on here. We all know what it is, how it pours and what it does taste like. No need to go into all that. Its not good. Another rating!

Pours fizzy yellow beer ish. Small to non existent head. Nose is barely existent as well but it is lightly fruity. Taste is watered down and bland up front. Finish has a very nasty bitter like eating garbage. Mouthfeel is crisp and clean, abrupt shortness on the aftertaste with super light body. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very very boring.  Tastes like mendota springs.  Low ibu, low alcohol, no malt.  Bland.

Original review 12/9/09. Grabbed a can of this from the grocery store for $1.49. I figured, why not? I used to drink this exclusively when it first came out (before my eyes were opened), so how bad could it be now. 

Poured into my pilsner glass. Pours a crystal clear pale yellow with a huge billowy white head on top. Decent retention; left some sticky lace in its wake. Scents of corn, grains, and crackers. The body is extremely thin and wet. No crisp bite at all, even though I can see plenty of carbonation in this beer. Flavors of buttered corn and white bread. Very weak. Drinkability is high as it’s like drinking corn flavored-water, but who’d want to? If you’re gonna get a macro, there’s better than this out there.

Bottle at random Nashville establishment. It’s really the worst fucking shit I’ve ever had. It looks like water. It tastes like fizzy water with a finish reminiscent of Frito’s Corn Chips. Ugh!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Can. Very weak malt aroma.Yellow with a small white head. Thin malt flavor. Thin watery body. What did I expect from a beer that claims 99 calories? At least I can say I’ve rated worse.
Pours a pale clear yellow.  Aroma of corn, metal.  Flavor is water, grain, slightly skunky.
The only difference in this and bud light is the bottle and the price. Just another way for Budweiser to hog more shelf space
Golden yellow in color with a tall head and goes away quickly. Minimal malt aroma with similar taste. Not offensive, but not good either.
Bottle. Same bland beer as all the rest of the  AH line. Good to wash down nachos, hot dogs and pretzels.
355ml can. Pale yellow colour and very clear with a small white head. Aromas of straw and grain that are very ordinary with not a lot happening. Very ordinary.

Pours a pale straw with a starch white half finger of fizzy boring looking head.  Really have to snort at this one to gather much of anything.  Corn and sweet subtle grains.  Wet grass.  Slight metallic zing in front with a corny bread flavor as it fades.  Mouthfeel is akin to urine.  Overall, you’re better off drinking soda.

Okay, before you get to thinking that I have no taste in beer...  My rating really reflects my opinion of this beer as compared to its peers (Coors Light, Miller Light, etc.)  This is my lawnmower beer of choice.  Don’t know what it is.  I hate regular Bud and would rather dehydrate than put it to my lips.  That said, Select is what I drink when I have to operate heavy machinery or for some other reason can’t drink a real beer.  Even the AB Brewmaster can’t explain it. Best answer he could give me is a high malt content in Select.
Clear yellow, foamy white head. The smell is grainy, weak, rice, and weak. The taste is basically water with some corn and rice mix. Weak. Cold and goes down easy.
12 oz bottle pours a gold color with a white head.  Another example of the big beer companies flavorless beers.
Smells and tastes of nothing, looks like piss mixed with apple juice and club soda. Terrible.

Aroma of corn, light hay, some apple, and light floral hops. Appearance is gold with white head. Flavor of water, sweet corn and virtually no finish. Palate was bubbly and a little fizzy. Perhaps the closest thing to water I have ever tasted from a beer bottle; boring but unoffensive. My score reflects a lack of "beer" experience from this beer, not that it tastes bad- it would need a taste at all to offend!

Draft in a weizen glass - pours a slightly golden yellow with no head. Nose is yeast and rice.  Taste is a bit more bitter than the regular flavored bud. Very watery and easy to drink, but so light on flavor.
Poured a clear gold with good carbonation. Minimal taste but not terrible. An easy drinking beer.
Select, Industrial, Lager.  Very clear, very yellow, very carbonated.  Tick!

12oz bottle.  Reviewed from notes during the Bud tasting at Busch Gardens years ago.  Yes that’s right Bud tasting.  It’s light in body, light in flavor, with pale adjunct ass flavor and aroma.  I can see why people enjoy this, it’s boring one-sided water.
A clear, pale yellow pour with a white head.  It has a mild grain aroma with a similar mild taste.  The light body has a thin texture and lively carbonation.

Served in 12oz chilled bottle straight from fridge at home. Ice cold.

 Aroma: Extremely skunky. Very pungeant.  Go into a cow barn and you’ll get a sense of what this smells like. Appearance: Extremely pale. Taste: Very light, not much of anything but a glimpse of corny, strawy, skunky tasting malt. Palate: Drank like a cheap beer. Very light and sticky with excessive carbonation. Notes: Not impressed by this cheap beer attempting to fill the gap between Bud Light and Budweiser. Excessive skunkiness made drinking this one unplesant, and felt excessively watered down

Bottle.  Pours a pale yellow with a thin white head.  Aroma is sweet and almost smells like syrup.  Flavor is slightly sweet with a touch of malt.  Tastes more like corn/rice rather than malts.  Finish is metallic.  Very thin and watery.

Drank from can on camping trip. Thin, watery, perhaps a bit more aroma/taste/body than Bud Light. Harsh, faintly metallic carbonation. Neutral lager finish. Drinkable, but that’s also true of tap water.

Better smell, color, and taste than regular Bud. Nothing special here but it is worth drinking if your making the best of a bad beer situation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Still not a very good beer but it is a little bit better than the regular bud light.

Serving glass: Poured from bottle into Pint glass.

Appearance: Very pale and almost has an artificial neon glow. Almost no head.

Aroma: Sweet, sickly grains.

Taste: Not much. A little bit of of sweet apple when cold. Starts tasting like metal as it warms.

Palate: Extremely high carbonation with almost no body.

Overall: It seems like carbonated water that has gone bad. On the plus side, I guess it is drinkable.
Aroma is a cheap corn malt. Taste is almost identical. Overall an average light pale lager.
Bottle - very basic, standard cheap beer; better than Coors Light, but if I had to make the painful choice between the ligtt Bud family products (Select vs Light), I would go Light
It poured an almost clear color, but had a yellowish tint. The aroma is? The taste was some staleness. Palate is very thin and watery. Great beer to use with bbqing.

A: The pour is a pale golden straw color with a short lived white head.

S: Smells like nothing.  Mostly just water.  There is a little bit of straw aroma, but that’s almost all that I can pick up from it.  The lightest hint of pale malt and a decent corn note.

T: There is actually a little bit of flavor to it.  Some pale cracker type malts with a fair amount of corn to it.  Very light all around with just a little bit of straw.

M: Light in body with a medium carbonation.

O: Less awful than many of the other Budweiser variants.  Still wouldn’t have this again.
Awesome, a diet beer...like more diet than light beer.  I guess this could be the mic-ultra of bud....mistake...tasteless, literally.
can.  Poured clear pale amber with a small receding white head. Sweet grainy corn aroma. Prickly carbonation, light mouthfeel. Watered down pale malt flavour. Quick dry finish.
Boy this stuff is good. Tastes of light bland malts. nose is unpleasant. light and smooth mouthfeel. Bleh as expected.

Thanks to my bandmates (Pete and Christina) for bringing this one back from the States (as we cannot buy it up here). Pours a yellow colour, clean, with lots of carbonation, a big foamy-soap white head, decent lacing and average retention. Chemical aromas of corn and well, chemicals (made to be dranked from the bottle). Crisp mouthfeel (which is what they were looking for). The flavours are mild, with hardly any in the finish, but mostly all corn (and maybe rice). So, at least the taste is not in the chemical department. I can see why drinkers of light beers would like this one, straight from the bottle.

This beer is ok.  Drank one last night sitting outside at a local bar on their deck.  Taste similar to Bud Light.  Water downed version that major beer companies made to compete with each other for lower carbs for the brew.  For the price, I’ll stay with IC Light when seeking a low carb, low calorie brew.
Pours yellow with hardly any head. Not really any aroma or flavor for that matter. Only really good for a tailgate or float trip

Yuck.  Getting desperate for new ratings.  This one tastes like Miller lite, but maybe slightly sweeter.  Same old skanky corn peewater otherwise.  I would drink this only if trying to rehydrate after a long bike ride, and I couldn’t find any water.
16 oz tin bottle.  Pours faint yellow in colour, next to no head.  No aroma and hardly and flavour. Ricey.

I had this the other day while drinking with my non craft buddy. His little 2 year actually was his beer bitch running to get these all day so it made me reconsider kids for a split second. Anyway, drank directly from the can, going old school...The aroma actually isn’t that bad, its lightly skunky but more sweet corn and some hops come through...The taste was better than expected as well, slightly skunky but really just light sweetness with hops. I crushed one of these and would drink a few of these if I had too, not bad.
Tastes similiar to Miller Lite, watery and pretty much flavourless all around although a good tailgate beer.

Reviewed from notes, although it’s hard to forget this.

Pours as if someone put two drops of yellow food coloring inside of a glass of water. Pours with a bit of white head, but that quickly recedes into nothing and leaves zero lacing. Smells like a stale loaf of bread in between slices of cardboard. Tastes about the same, although thankfully tames it down a bit. Feel and drinkability is about the same as carbonated water.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 10-08-2010

Translucent gold, thin white head, watery amd filmy with high carbonation.



Aroma: corn alcohol.



Taste: sweet rice and corn residue, public restroom air freshener, and carbonic acid.

12oz bottle. Pours like any megabrewed light lager - clear, pale yellow, white head. No nose to speak of. Does have a crisp, clean taste, what there is of it. Would be a good lawnmower beer on a hot day.
This beer was ok. Was purchased at safe way about 3 years ago. I believe the new select took its place
12 oz. Bottle.  Another rams produced nothing to it beer from anheiser busch. A lot like the regular bud.

For all my love of cheap American beers, I tend to avoid the the ones marketed as light and really tend to avoid ones marketed as low carb. I believe this is only my second ultra-light I’ve tried after Michelob Ultra and it confirms my suspicion that all these beers basically suck. The one characteristic this carries over from the original Budweiser is a bit of apple-like character. In Budweiser, it’s not bad but here it’s the only thing going on, giving this the character of green apple flavored bottled water. It is not some sort of abomination unto man like some people would have you believe and probably if it said something different on the label it’d be rated over 2.0 by most people here but I am not going to complain about that. I am also never going to drink this again.
Golden with a white head when poured. Very smooth with no after taste. By far my favorite beer to chill and drink with.

I was pleasantly surprised by this beer and generally speaking all my friends felt the same way.  It wouldn’t be my beer of choice but it certainly did the trick.  Its perfect for a cheap easy beer while prepartying in a parking lot before a concert.

Yet another 12oz longneck sampled at Cowboy’s Dance Hall in San Antonio, TX.  Why is this and Bud Light made?  They both seem like the same yellow, lightly sweet, fizzy bottles of very little.  Why is this "select"?
Well it wasn’t as awful as I was dreading. Though there is little to report about this stuff. There is nothing to it , it is not offensive, but again there is nothing there.
Poured from a 16 oz can, a yellow body and thin white fizzy head. Very thin, not bad but no real flavor. Points awarded for not offending.
Tasted on tap in St. Louis, Missouri.  Very light pale and clear appearance.  More carbonated and a more definite malt body than Budweiser but still light with not too much flavor.
Poured from a can at the Bears/Seahawks tailgate. Clear yellow color, thin fizzy white head. Indistinguishable from Bud Light in my opinion. Easy to drink.

Bottle. Pours a clear, light yellow with a fizzy, white head. Mild cereal aroma with faint, floral hops. Sweet, lightly sugary flavor with some grains and faint bitters. Light bodied with fizz carbonation. Crisp, semi-sweet finish. Not offensive.
Drank from bottle, thin with aroma of stale corn and some metal mixed in, hard to get this whole thing down.

Drank on tap from the Shawnee Lookout Hamilton County Park near Cincinnati, Ohio - Alright, I and my buddy Roger were out hiking and exploring the park when we got some cheese coneys and libations in the park’s visitor center/museum/golf clubhouse. Well, since I’d never had it before and we’d been hiking in the summer heat, I opted for a cold cup of Bud Select.  Although I have a natural beer drinker’s anti A-B bias,this one struck me as being non-offensive, being a clear golden mass lager with less mass. So it goes...

Stole it at a party: I guess as a 999th rating this is a pretty crappy one considering the fact that this beer is remarkably crappy. Very thin and watery with a mild semblance of beer recognizable if attention is truly given to attempting to figure out the category of beverage this is. In other words, this is almost not beer and I feel bad dignifying it with another rating, but then again, I am kind of a whore. Watery, tiny amount of hops, and some adjuncts.
Bud Select is a light beer, with a very light taste. In fact, there isn’t much flavor or aroma at all. Crispness is ok, but not much else to mention.
99 cal is as low as I have gone....scared to try the 55.... I will man up one day...
well I guess I buy this for the rating? What a sad excuse for a "beer". watery.
Isn’t this Michelob Ultra in a different bottle? If not then oops, who’d have thought that piss would be distinguishable from...well, piss

If budweiser spends so much money on marketing, how come i don’t know what budweiser select is suppost to be.  After drinking it, it taste right inbetween budweiser and bud light.  But why is it Select?  I thought this was supposed to be a more refined beer.  Anyways, it has just a little more body than bud light.  I will not be drinking this beer again any time soon.
One for the tickers.  A decent golf course beer with a bit of wood flavor.  No one expects much flavor here and it delivers.

Sweet malt aroma. They say they use 2-row and it smells like it. Clear golden color with decent white head. Flavor is malty sweet and with a dry finish. Decent enough, not awful, not great. As an American Premium Lager, its okay. As for the broader ratebeer category of Pale Lager, there are plenty that are way better.

Serving: 12 oz. can. 

I got this POS from as part of a $5 "grab bag".  Pissed.  Anyway, here we go.  It pours a light gold color with a foamy white head.  The nose is stale hops, grainy, and generally smells like piss.  Can’t wait to taste this one.  Gee, it tastes like piss too.  Very stale grains and hops with a slight vegetal undertone.  The only saving grace is the relatively clean finish.  Light, watery body, average carbonation.  Who the hell drinks this crap?

Typical macro lager piss yellow color. Super high carbonation, no noticeable smell whatsoever. Tastes like bitter grains, corn, and filthy water. I thought this would be better than regular Budweiser/Bud Light, but it is actually much worse.

I had this at the United Center during Game 1 of the Stanley Cup Finals.  I thought, "this must be a slightly better than a Bud, right?".  I was wrong, it tastes exactly like it just minus taste.  If I knew it was the whole "fit" beer I wouldn’t have gotten it.  Oh well.
Watery, Im not even sure if it has alcohol in it?  No point in drinking this!

Looks like every other Domestic Macro Light. Really pale yellow. Has a bit of white head for the category.  Smells OK. It smells a little malty, but no corn like alot of others of it’s kind. Clean and Crisp. It is suprisingly malty. No hops at all as far as I can tell.  Thin and Watery. Kinda high on the carbonation.

Very drinkable. The perfect beer if you are going knock back a bunch at a game or something. This has become my crap beer of choice. It is Clean and Crisp with a decent taste to it. It is low on calories, has decent alcohol levels, isn’t expensive and is really easy to drink. If you want to drink all the way through a double header grab a case and have at.

The only difference between Budweiser "Select" and regular ol’ Budweiser?

The "Select" is the stuff that came from the business end of of Clydesdale, not just any old horse.

Funny can. Golden with a small white head that disappears. Aroma is sweet corn and general grain. Dry, bitter and watery. Thin watery finish. Really like watered down Budweiser. Maybe this is bud light and budweiser just mixed.

Anheuser-Busch, Inc.--Budweiser Select--2005 12 oz. Bottle.  4.00% ABV--10 IBU’s.?  (2.25 / 5.0)  Pilsner--Light.  Low Carb--99 Kcal Brew.  Mild head.  Clear thin bright light golden color.  Very mild front aroma.  Thin crisp watery bland Pils caramel citrus adjunct body.  Refreshing clean mild citrus end.  OK bland Light.  Sampled 3/21/2005.

Next to no aroma.  Pours a small white head that dissipates fairly rapidly.  Some lacing (surprisingly).  Really not much of a flavor either.  Light corn and malt.  Really thin and watery.  Not awful for what it is, and pretty standard for MilBudCoors base brews.

Bud Select is a favorite of mine. I enjoy its crips clean taste and the light pale color suits its purpose. It pours with a clean white head, and provides a refreshing taste for the pallette on a warm sunny day.

A-not bad. yellow in color but darker than most light beers

S- eh. nothing special. some malt. I guess if you tried hard enough you can smell some hops too.

T- most light beers are completely unoffensive to the palate. this is not the case. It had a fairly strong bitter (but not a good bitter) taste and the nasty aftertaste stuck
.
O- its not. its hard to finish one of these let alone ever drink another. My choice in AB light lagers is definately Bud Light.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 04-12-2007 23:46:39
Bottle. Clear. No aroma. Light and frothy Thin watery unpleasant taste. Starts sour with a hint of artificial apple flavour. Falls completely flat with a nasty finish. Overall, horrible.

Pours a golden yellow with a white head that reduces quickly. Tastes like a light bud - but not like a bud light. Kinda the coke zero of coke. Hits the tongue with a weird sourlike taste and leaves a tacky aftertaste.
Malty and watery.  Sort of an inbetween beer of bud and bud light but equally as shitty in flavor, aroma and appearance.
Bottle. Pours clear yellow gold with a white head. Corny sweetish malts, light grains, adjuncts, etc. Blah.
Bottle - Falls right in the realm with other US domestic lights.  This beer has it’s place in backyard BBQ’s, and when you want to slam a few fairly fast.  Beers like this do have their place.

Pours clear yellow-gold. Medium aroma is metallic and off-putting (poured from bottle, not can). Taste is sour and metallic with no palate. Honestly, this beer was purchased because the caps were needed for a craft project. Would not purchase again except under dire circumstances.
On tap.  Very similar to beweiser, but maybe a little better.  I personally would rather have a miller high life.
Pours golden with little to no head, taste in between bud light and budweiser, not good with little to no flavor, maybe a bit of corn.

12 oz bottle. Smells a little sweet; corn, cheapness also. Pours yellow with a thin collar of foam, big bubbles, not bad lacing. Taste is a little sweet, finishes with a slight bitterness. Bland, but not as bland as others of this ilk. Slightly above average macro.

Draft, Golden pour with a white head.  Aroma is slightly sweet and corny.  Flavor is bland and cerealy.  Not noticably better than Budlight and inferior to the regular bud that it was tasted side by side with.  not really worth the 2 dollars for a pour.

had a little while ago.  disgusting for me, but maybe not ot others.  the flavors did not intermingle well.  one thing overpowered another.  aftertaste was groteque and unsatisfying.  will not drink again and can not pair with any food what so ever.  dont torture tourself by trying this.

Better than Bud Light.
Light yellow color, no head.
Would drink over Bud Lgith any day, I suppose?
Taste just like Bud/Bud Light and any other macro beer.  Would never pay money for this one.
I really dont know what the select means a joke I guess, because if this is the beer you selected the laughs on you brother.
I don’t think I can add anything enlightening about this beer. Not the worst I’ve ever had but it’s far from good.
Not much going on with this beer. Pale yellow color, not much head and the same light beer taste, hop water. Still shocks me how many people say these types of beers are their "favorite".

For only 99 calories, a good alcoholic drink.  As a beer, its a lousy draft.  Light amber pour, minimal head dissolves very quickly leaving no lacing.  Watery, second press malt flavor, no follow through, no complexity, its pretty much just carbonation and malt.  My preferred "light" beer &#40less than 112 calories&#41, not a "good" beer by any means.
this beer is good for a cheap night out never going to drink more then one .
This is the very best of the bad, cheap lagers. If I can only afford a Bud, it’s a Bud Select.
I couldn’t agree more.  This beer is a joke.  I would kick my own dog if I came up with this beer.  Try a Mil. Best and it sure as hell tops this dogdung....
Why does this even exist?  To kill Miller Lite?  Nice try, A-B.  Another cruddy beer from a cruddy company.
I don’t want to comment on this.  Do I have to?  Bud + .036549 rounded. At least there is some more taste to this, even though its not good!

This is easily the most disappointing beer I’ve ever had.  I think to myself - hey Jay Z’s doing commercials, and yeah, he’s not too relevant anymore, but what the hell, it could be kinda cool anyways.  It came in some funky looking thin cans.  I was drinking it on a roof deck at night in downtown Manhattan.  So really, everything looking up at this point.  So then I take a sip and... nothing.  Just nothing.  I have often described it by saying that the entire experience is over while you’re still waiting for the taste.  Granted, that means it goes down very very smooth, and I could probably drink a million of them at a time (ok, that might be an exaggeration, I’ll test it out later).  So yeah, similar to Bud Select, this review seemed to have so much promise but now I’m just gonna end it without ever saying too much about the beer.  Jay Z’s alright though, I mean, he got Beyonce, so props for that.
12 fl oz bottle. Pours clear and golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma is sweet cornish. Dry, bitter and watery. Thin watery finish.
Sampled at a bar. Not bad by Bud standards. Well drinking and tempting to go back for another unlike other products.

Bottled. A golden beer with a white head. The aroma is sweet with notes of brewing syrup. The flavor is sweet with light notes of vitamins as well as brewing cereal and just a touch of malt. The body is watery thin. Forgetable.

12 oz. bottle.  Somewhere between Bud and Bud Light, I suppose.  Easier to drink than Bud, slightly more grain, rice, corn than Bud Light.  I guess the low carbs are a plus, and it’s not offensive like some others in its class.

Pale yellow.  No head.  I honestly don’t know what to say, because I couldn’t taste ANYTHING, good or bad.  No bad flavors for me knock it down (so in that sense it’s better than most A-B products), but nothing good to bump it up either.  Just fizzy yellow water.  If you’re just looking for a lawnmower beer, you could do worse.  Or much, much better.

Pale yellow, fizzy head, faint aroma of  grain. Flavor of slight grain, virtually no finish, virtually no hops. At least there are no offensive, vegetal, or off flavors. But - Long brewed? Bavarian hops? Dark gold in color? What a joke...
Some maltiness, no hops. Over the top carbonation. Watery, but clean. When your father-in-law offers you a beer, drink the damn thing and say thank you! He could do worse than this.

Light pale yellow color. Small head when poured. Carbinated with a crisp clean taste.  Smooth with little aftertaste.  One of my favorite Budweiser Beers and at only 99 calories a good choice for someone watching their weight.

Free sample at the supermarket...in this economy? Go figure. Clear yellow pour. A bit maltier and less off flavors than Bud or Bud Light. Grainy and metallic still. Dry and fizzy...not repeatable, or good in any way.
Great beer if you are planning a long night of partying and drinking. Smooth flavor nuver makes you full and also does not give you the hangover like most beers will cause.
Smooth beer. Better than Bud Light. Pours a pale yellow. Good for consuming a lot in one time period.

Bland, a weak pale lager.
with a aroma that smells of subway urinal.
It is low cal! 
Why drink this beer?
12oz bottle. Pour is almost clear, but has a yellow tint and a small translucent head. Nose is...air? a little staleness. Palate is very thin and watery. flavor is water and some light cardboard
Clear pour, low head and lace, rising bubbles. Low beery aroma. Fizzy but barely beer flavored water. Corny, sweet, macro pale lager. Better than Michelob Ultra, worse than Miller Lite.
pale yellow in colour with thin white head. N o aroma, tin body. Really is bland yellow water!!!!

Budweiser Select has a thin, white head and a clear, yellow-golden appearance, with lots of bubbles streaming up. The aroma is a typical American-style lager smell, but it is a good smell. Taste is very sweet, with some grain and a touch of hops across the sip. This beer is balanced and not too light. The aftertaste is even tart, too some extent. The mouthfeel is light and watery, and Budweiser Select finishes crisp, clean, dry, and refreshing. Overall, this is one of the better light beers on the market, and I think it’s at least worth trying.

RJT

Aroma is of wet hay and sweet corn; brew has a pale golden appearance. Pours a thin head that diminishes quickly. Tastes like watered down Bud LIght. Slight bitter up front, finishes crisp and clean. Light everything: body, texture, and carbonation. Overall, very drinkable for a light beer. Flavor is a little on the short side, but if you are on a diet and restricting calories/carbs, this beer may be a good choice.

The pour is a pale golden yellow, with a large sudsy white head.  The aroma is mild, a touch of hop, other than that not much.  The beer is thin, the hops are very mild, the malts are not noticeable.  Highly carbonated.  The taste lingers on the the tounge.  Not a very good beer.

From can to shaker June 7, 2009.  Boy this beer is all marketing - I have never liked it.  I guess a slight more taste than Bud Light, but not very good.  Light corn/hay/ grainy taste with little head that dissipates and no lacing remaining.  Give me a Miller Lite please!  Would never spend money on this beer.

Served via draft and ingested from a tall hefeweizen glass.  I obviously wasn’t expecting much from this, but it was all they had at the restaurant I was at.  The most noticeable aroma was one of carbonation, it you can even call that an aroma.  Malt and hops were essentially undetectable.  Perhaps a little bit of rice and a touch of corn came through in the palate, if anything.  Overall, just like Budweiser and the rest of this conglomerate’s offerings, it was a joke.
Not sure if it is possible to pack less taste into a beer than this one.  Tastes like drinking from a dirty water fountain.
A nice featherweight alternative to bud.  If youre worried about calories this one is where to go, skip bud light.
It really is better than Bud/ Bud Light.  It is still 99% adjuncts, but has an ounce of malt and a few hops.  Lots of carbonation and bland corn with plenty of water.
One of the best low calorie beers i have had. ok tasting for a american lager but would rather have the big brother budweiser
This is the exact same thing as Bud Light, but with fewer calories I guess? I don’t know why people buy this garbage.....
Uh... better than bud light?  Yeah, that’s the nicest thing I say about this beer.

Bottle. A pale clear yellow with a thin fizzy head,well carbonated no lacing. Aroma of cooked corn and hay, and a hint of grain. Flavor is pretty bland,slightly sweet,corn and paper,slightly metallic. Thin watery body,with a crisp clean mouthfeel. This was drinkable and not really offensive but I don’t believe I would ever buy it again for any reason.

Overall Impression: 
You’ve had Bud Light, same beer different label

4 of 6 in the Pale lager vertical, trying to clean out the fridge of crap. Light gold pour with thin white head. Corn aroma. Has an actual body of malt sweetness. Taste is very light malt, better than regular Bud, but that is the most you will get out of me.

Draft at the steakhouse in a quasi celebration that they NO LONGER serve Coors Light.  I about fell out of my booth when the sprite of a waitress spouted that out.  I called the mamager over and asked if it was true. I’m sure he was expecting a fight, not a hug.  As I asked why, he stated that Bud was making a big push at the steakhouse and offered some "incentive".  As a lesser of two evils I ordered one of these since, as my wife pointed out....it was "on sale" or as you and I would define it two for one.   So here’s to capitalisim and the American way.  I ordered the least of Bud evils. To say that is is a bit creamier than normal Bud is true, but only if you focus upon the word "bit".  Considering the appitizers and my meal of chicken fajitas et al trimmings, I wasn’t too concerned about limiting my carb intake.   By far not the worst beer that I have ever had...(Sládkův Měšťan) but not memorable in anyway besides this rambling.
Nasty beer.  Too sweet of a palate with a lingering aftertaste.  I wouldn’t even give this beer to someone I didn’t like.
Probably the best of the beers branded under the "Budweiser" name, as at least this one has a slight bit of flavor to it. Still not good at all though.
Bottle.  Musty aroma.  Usual pale golden body with white head.  Vague cereal/corn flavor.  Metallic finish.  Terrible.

When poured looks like your typical american lager - pale and fizzy.  Aroma corny.  Flavor very similar to any other light beer though there is definitely a bit more mouthfeel and flavor to it.  Not bad for a hot day.

Budweiser Select taste almost the same as bud light. Bud select has a bit more heavier mouthfeel but the taste is close to the same.

The color is a very lght amber/orange

Smell is a little malt and hops.

Taste is watery hope taste.

Bud select ended up not being as bad as I expected but I only drink this when there is nothing else or it’s really hot and I’m in need of a beer that is not too heavy.

Serving type: can
I actually though this was a pretty drinkable beer. Not a great aroma, but it had an ok taste and went down smooth. Definitely better than Budweiser and Bud Light.
a clean refreshing watery beer. enjoyable for mass consumption. no flavor to speak of

So so bad.  I remember when this came out I was all interested to try it, and I bougtht a case.  It was hard to get through it.  Tastes like what would happen if you ground of chalk and mixed it with water.

Slightly better than Budweiser or Bud Light, mainly because it has less calories and doe snot taste as skunky.  Maybe that is because its watered down?  Probably.  Decently drinkable "light beer" compared to most Anheuser-Busch offerings, then again, when compared to their offerings is that really a compliment?
Slightly foul herbal aroma.  Really no flavor except a strange medicinal aftertaste... odd.  Overall it tastes like carbonated water.  Wierd.
I actually prefer this to regular Budweiser or Bud Light, but it is still watered down and over-filtered.  For a "light calorie" beer it is not bad, but that does not make it good by any means.
Tastes like nutty flavored water. nothing special here. if i have to drink something like thins i would rather have a bud heavy.

Decent beery aroma with no ill olfactory. Perhaps there is a bit of cooked veggie smells in there. Nice sparkling pale lager appearance. First thing I noticed on the tongue is the large amounts of CO2 which I apreciate greatly. No bitter attributres and easy to like for a lager lover. Does finish clean as stated on  the label. Friendly and easy to get along with. Lacks any offensive personality. Pleasantly surprized.
Surprisingly good; very drinkable.  Not as bitter as it’s counterparts.  My strip club beer of choice!
Quite possibly Budweiser’s best brew.  Tastes like a full bodied Bud but with much less calories.

clear light gold color, fluffy white head, no lace of which to speak.  aroma of light corn.  flavor is mostly corn, perhaps a suggestion of malt.  light bodied, clean finish.  a pedestrrian offering.  and i rather like its big brother budweiser.  free bottle at the lobby bar in my downtown st. louis hotel.
Pale yellow with a smooth white head.  Strange rice, adjunct sweet aroma.  Taste is cardboard, some more metallic adjuncts.

Bottle at Phillies game  Pours a clear yellow with a white head.  Aroma of grains and rice.  Taste is average macro swill.  Nothing very memorable but atleast is was cold.  I don’t think I would have it again unless it was all that was avalible.
This beer is great after a workout.  Very comparable to bud light with water overwhelming the palate.

What’s the difference from Bud Light, etc? It’s all yellow, fizzy, watery, and ricey. Low-carb beers are a disgrace unless you’re playing beirut/beer pong. Just drink vodka or something - it’s quicker!
12 oz can.  Poured a clear yellow color with a two finger white head.  Aroma was grainy.  The flavor was grainy and weak with a hint of grass.

Aluminum bottle 33 cl. [Served @ Liberty of the seas] I was told that the aluminum bottles are only made for the Cruise liners. But I see other people have had it as an aluminum bottle so I don’t really know if that is true or note. Average white head that mostly lasted. Fair display of lacework. Clear yellow color. Aroma of light grain, hay, grass, mild floral. Light bodied with an average carbonation and light dry texture. Light sweet and bitter flavor in balance. Light bitter dry finish. Not that bad when in the sun on a cruise on the way to Puerto Rico.
12 oz can from the can. No real aroma. Flavor is watery, weak, and grainy. If you are worried about calories and carbs drink water..... or this.
Bought on tap at local restaurant.  Absolutely no head and very little carbonation.  Taste was very bitter and not in a good way.  Worst thing I’ve tasted in a long, long time.
Quite possibly the worst light beer out there.   Watery, complete lack of any redeeming flavor.  Musty, sour, pee-esque.   Sugar added.  Unbelievable that people choose to drink this dreck regularly.

Aroma of Grain with a pleasing golden appearnce. Flavor is of grain and slight hops.  Light hops feel to the mouth.
Overalll pleasing and refreshing.

Born on: September 11th, 2008. The World Trade Center tragedy, like this shameful nightmare, will never be forgotten!

Appearance: Pours a clear, gold body with a thin, painfully brief, white head.

Smell: Feh! Another lifeless, uninspired aroma of tired, musty grains.

Taste: Sweet light pale malts with a tiny hint of bored grains. Faintly spicy hop character with a light bitterness. Finishes relatively drying and crisp.

Mouthfeel: Thin-bodied. Medium-plus carbonation.

Drinkability: As is the case with so many of these macro lager, there’s really just not much to it.

Pours very light yellow with a 2 finger fizzy white head that fades somewhat quickly and leaves no lacing. Aroma is grainy and sweet but almost nonexistent. Flavor is ridiculously weak vagueley sweet and adjunct laden, tastes strongly of tonic water. Body is thin and over carbonated. Basically beer for those who would rather have water.

12 oz. bottle from a non craft beer drinking neighbor.  Pours light yellow with a medium sized white head.  Aroma was grainy, but overall pretty weak.  There was not much in the way of flavor other than grainy malts.  This was what I expected, not very good.
The beer was weak, watered down, and does not have a clean finish.  overall i was not impressed with this beer.  I think it will soon go the way of bud dry.
Bottle. Pours a light yellow with high carbonation. Nose of straw, rice, and cereal.

Pour is a pale yellow with a thin white head and carbonation
Nose is corn wheat and not much else.
Taste is thin and drawn out there is corn and wheat.
Finish is Nil
Overall not a very good beer, except for slamming
This beer is as bad as bud lite; very little taste, too light in color, no aroma, can’t think of a good reason to drink it again.
Bottle.  Probably one on the most watered down beers Ive ever tried.  Tasted like soda water and maybe a hint of malt and hops, but very very thin hints.
Out of bottle........not as bad as I was expecting......but....not that great

I have friends who think this beer has "too much" taste.  Pours almost clear with think white head.  Hardly any smells or taste.  I guess it’s ok if you have to serve lots of people, but I don’t be drinking it again any time soon.
Eh, decent camping beer or party beer.  Sat down for proper review.  Bad um lots of cerial rice.  Bleach white big head on pore...im just going to stop lol.
This is just another pale Lager made in the great USA.  This is an upscale bud without the upscale taste, good to give away and keep the good stuff for yourseld.
I drank this because it was free.  No aroma, no taste.  Shocking I know.  Like drinking water.
This beer is great!... if you want to drink an entire case. Typical watery taste. Typical lack of aroma. Pale color, but like I said, if you want a lot of beer at once, go with it.
This is a great beer to drink a lot of when watching some football. Other than that it is an american pale lager and there about all the same.

Bottles.  Drank these at a euchre party. Typical Budweiser look and taste. I drank them cold.  They quenched my thirst.  It was better than the boxed wine that was served at the same party.  Pass on this one.

12 oz can poured into glass. PIss gold in color with a thin head that disappeared quickly.  Smell of malt and alcohol.  The flavor is very similar to the other bud ales however it ends much more crisp.  Shouldn’t be as expensive as how much Anheuser-Busch charges for this product.  Also wish they had not lowered the alcohol from regular Budweiser as much as they did.  Oh well though, thats what you get for 99 calories.

Thought it was nicer than normal bud and nicer than quite a few pale lagers I’ve had this year. Think a 1% overall is a little harsh. Still a bit rubbish though. Better than bud and bud light but thats like saying a smack in the mouth is better than a smack in the knackers.

Can 355 ml 

 Appearance:  watery washed gold with hint of amber , small fizzy isles on top.1+
 Nose:  Sweet grainy feel with light dusty hop character. Mineral , fruity middle (plum?). 
 Flavor/Palate : Thin and watery . Melted cardboard with plastic bag hint. Light watery finish of slightly sour grain. How was is SELECTED? It does remain mystery of our lives. Sweet light grainy notes , mineral water with its plum like strange off side. This could be “decent” light macro if not that funky side.
Pale yellow with a thin white head. Lack of flavor. I would rather " select " Natural Light over this. It’s cheaper and has the same taste.
select my ass.  more hore piss.  watery, funky, grainy, smelly, not good.  NOT GOOD I SAY! Drink water instead.  Nasty.
Same garbage from Budweiser, different label, don’t waste your time and money, just pee into a cup of seltzer, it’s cheaper.

Poured a really clear weak yellow color with a boring whte head. Aroma was pretty bland just lots of corn and some grassy. Flavor was much the same, reminded me of regular budweiser but cleaner and without the saltiness.
I guess "Select" means this is top tier stuff, but it’s not imo, any different from the other AB offerings.  Skip it.
I just don’t get it. Anybody who actually spends their money on this has lost their ability to taste.

Date: 08/03/2008

Mode: Draft

Source: Summits - Woodstock



Appearance: clear pale yellow, fine white head, thick lace patterns, 

Aroma: light malt aroma with a hint a floral hops, 

Flavor: light malt flavor, touch of sweet cereal, light floral hops, 



Aroma: 3/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 3/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 5/20

Rating: 1.7/5.0
Drinkability: 5/10

Score: */4
bottled@hill tavern. Normal poor lager. Weak malt aroma, Clear pale yellow, flavor is refreshing nothing else.
If I had to drink an AB product this would be it, this is the smoothest and cleanest of the big three in their lineup.  Just slightly smoother and maltier than Bud and Bud light.
Who is Bud kidding, we all know that this is just Bud Light in a jazzed up bottle.

The first time I had this, it was very flavorful and bitter in an odd way.  The second time I had it, it was exceedingly boring/watery.  Turns out it was skunked the first time. Budweiser should deliberately skunk more of their beers.

This was surprisingly better than I thought it would be. It had almost a wine type aroma to it, I’m not sure why. The taste was better than bud and bud light. Nothing great, but I expected that I’d be giving it a 1.
If they wanted to make a beer that tastes like the mixed bud and bud light together then bravo, we now have bud select.

Pours a golden color with quickly disappearing white head. Lots of carbonation can be seen. Mellow aroma. Corn. Grains. Rice. Nothing too standout here. Thin and watery. This beer is actually NOT as good as regular Budweiser, which has more of a malty character. What’s the point, I ask?
A very clean & crisp drink.   Not special, but it is a refreshing change & with virtually no aftertaste.   Just an all-around good-tasting beer.   No complaints.

The aroma is mostly of corn and other adjuncts, same as regular bud. Maybe slightly less offensive.  Boring appearance of yellow, with a white head, true to the style.  The flavor is of corn, malts, other adjuncts.  No hops flavor, or hoppiness in the finish.  Great if you want to get sh1tfaced on a budget.

Clean Taste that is easy to drink.

Sits decent in Stomache

Have had better tasting beers

But this one is good if your friend has some in the fridge
not bad for the type of beer, cheap and watery, pours a golden yellow with no aroma.

Pale gold pour.  Watery, light and crisp.  The only reason i tried it was it was left in the condo (amongst other crap a/b products) by my wife’s aunt.  It was good beach swill and it doesn’t matter when the kids knock one over...

After a while it gets tiring rating all the horrible beers from my early drinking years. Another skunky smelling beer with few redeeming qualities other than its sharp looking black and red can. It’s better than bud light, and it has more alcohol and fewer calories so for a cheap bbq beer its not too terrible.

Tastes like every other macro lager.  I’m not sure what makes this select, besides maybe it wasn’t tossed around baked in the sun after it was bottled.  To advertise that it’s low in calories and carbohydrates proves that the flavor is a direct product of the cheap/ minimal ingredients.

Don’t get me wrong, I love low calorie items, but it’s not why I drink beer.

Very clear gold with a fizzy white head. Aroma is very light, almost non existant. Flavor is similar with trace rice, corn, barley and drying hops. So faint, this is like seltzer water with barley. Drank six 16 oz. aluminum bottles of this at the Hard Rock Casino Pool in Las Vegas, NV.

7/1/08 From the bottle.  Aroma is a blend of sour pils malt and light metallic noble hops, simple and not too inviting.  Appearance is clear yellow with a medium maintained white head. Flavor is very simple and similar to aroma, with low sweetness and moderate bittering.  Mouthfeel is low bodied with a strong carb texture. Overall, this is just not sweet enough, and also needs more complexity.

a typical american brew with alot of water added. way too overpriced. split an 18 pack with my cousin and didnt feel a thing. just a beer that you can drink all day. if your worried about carbs go with natural. a girly beer.

Eh, sometimes it amazes me how these big macro breweries can get away with basically rebottling the same beer in different bottles and selling it as something different. This beer is almost indistinguishable from bud light. Tastes maybe a little better. Anyways it isnt worth your time or money so dont waste either on this beer.
I hate this one too. I made a vow with myself to not have anymre AB made beers.

As with most Budweiser products other than Bud Light the can/bottle is awesome.  I hate paying for Super Bowl commercials when I purchase beer but I think Bud Select is OK.  Extra-weak, extra-pale lager, has more taste than Keystone Light but maybe a little less than Mich Ultra.  I don’t mind drinking this stuff, especially when there are more than 6 beers planned for the evening.  I don’t think there are any hops at all used in the brewing process here.  Better than PBR Light.  Big effing deal.
on tap, yelllow color and small faint head, this tasted much like a standard Bud but has better finish to it and a little more crisp
Better than any other Bud product (damning with faint praise) and not horrible for being so light in calories.
yeah 1, 12oz thin can, given as a "gift" slammed to my face, it tastes like garbage, and has a worse aftertaste than any other bud product...i’d still drink it if it was free though.
Not much different then the regular budweiser, It’s a bit easier to drink i guess...still tasteless.

Pours a pale golden color with thin white head.  Subdued malt aroma with hints of wet hay, cereal grain, and a bit of citrus.  Light bodied with good carbonation.  Soft malt taste that quickly gives way to a clean, crisp finish that is dry and short without much, if  any at all, hop flavor.  If you want to avoid beer face, this is the beer to try.  It is an interesting novelty, reminiscent of Asahi Super Dry.  Try with a Reuben or any other hot sandwitch.
this stuff is absolutely terrible. tastes like feet. i nearly spit it out. i dont like bud and this is even worse
This taste basically the same as regular bud, but more expensive. Its not really all that less filling. Very watered down. Ok carbonation.
I love fact this this tastier and less filling beer is the same keg price as regular Bud and Bud Light. That’s all I have really.

This is just bud light. Stop repackaging this stuff. It’s like all those milwaukee and red dog and pabst types that are under Miller now. It’s all the same stuff! And who brags about having "only" 4.3% alcohol on the commercial description? Are people shooting for more watered down beer and I’m not aware of it? B-M-C has basically forced the masses to value the things beer drinkers absolutely DON’T value.
Bottle.  They took everything that was appealing about the king and said no your on a diet asshole, you cant have dessert.  God this piss yellow corn lager is crap.
Passable flavor, but overpowered by the lack of anything else...or the abundance of too much to improve. Ok for quenching a thirst on a hot day.

Great beer for my anorexic lesbian steps sisters’ older self righteous femenist self-loathing man-bashing slutty closet bulemia ridden friends.

Enjoy!

Pours almost clear like expected with white head.  Smells like an AB product.  Targeted at the "low carb" crowd.  Typical watered down light beer, however I can tolerate this one a little more than some others.
Just another beer to enjoy while cutting the lawn or painting something.  The only good thing is that it’s low in calories for those who are watching their weight.
Better than bud or bud light. Still just another crap product from AB. Noting impressive about it.
My favorite of the Budweiser line. Best taste of all of them and the least fattening. Not nearly as watered down as the rest of the American Lagers.

Select of what? had this at a Phillies game was in a plastic bottle but i don’t care if it was in a golden chalice this stuff was gross i gave it away once i saw the miller guy finally come ..... i learned a lesson patience is a virtue! 
No flavor just gives you nothing just hope i don’t have flashbacks
This is better than Bud Light and less in calories and other junk. It tastes better and goes down easier. Love it.
Pours golden yellow colour, thin white head with an overly malted, overly watery taste. Another typical crap beer from AB. Nothing special about it.

Seems to be more carbonated that regular Budweiser. The aroma is putrid. Bad actually. But the taste is better. Aside from the carbonation it seems very close to Bud Light. It does not have so much of the rice ethanol taste of regular Budweiser. Overall not very good, but okay if you want to get wasted for cheap and it’s on sale.
I remember when it came out and they thought it was the shit. It is funny how you go to a bar and they have 15 taps and they are all AB and Miller products and they pretty much taste the same.
very light yellow body is very clean clear with lively carbonation very thick head not my favorite i would choose bud light over it

There is not much to say or taste here. It pours very light yellow. The body is very clean and clear with lively carbonation that forms a thick white head. The aroma is light, mostly of rice and hay. There is not a bit of hops anywhere. The flavor is also very light. Mostly of rice, paper and hay, that leads you to a crisp clean finish. Overall its low carbohydrate, low calories and low on flavor.
I have to say it is better than bud light, but still nothing to brag about.  It is decent for the price though.

Bottle.  Pours a light golden yellow with a large, white and active head that fades to a thin sized head.  Aroma and Taste are very faithful to the normal Budweiser.  Some would say this is a bad thing, but for being a lighter version of Budweiser, I say it is a wonderful thing.  Better than Bud Light and is crisp, clean, smooth, refreshing and inexpensive.  Overall, not bad.

Pours a pale golden. Just about what you’d expect. Aroma exists, which is a bit surprising. A little sweet, a little yeasty. Flavor is much the same. Not a whole lot there, honestly...but whats there is surprisingly crisp, mellow and...god forbid, almost decent. Certainly thinner than what I’m used to, but its smooth and doesn’t have the taste of animal urine, which is surprising for an AB product. I wouldn’t drink it again, but it was much better than I expected.

Only after I finished this brew did I look at the born-on date to realize this beer was 3 years. old. My suggestion: Cellar this one. lol
Very little taste, drinks smooth, almost like a soft drink.  It’s drinkable, but not much else can be said that’s good about it.

this is why people hate us as americans, this beer is a slap in the face to real beer drinkers every where,no hops even tasted,no grain bill, just h20,
with some beer in it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!MALACORE

See Michelob Ultra... or any other light lager for that matter. It’s not awful but not good either. 4.3% is actually surprising. This just isn’t smooth, not good and not refreshing enough for me to want to ever drink it again though.
Bud select is my favorite bud product. It is rich in taste, full of flavor and easy to put down. Enough said.
Drinkable, affordable, but there are more choices than this, and much better from the company itself.
I’m still trying to figure out what’s so fucking "select" about this. Tastes like every other cheap American lager: Like shit. Drinkable, but barely.

Bottle- Pale golden/straw pour with a very short lived white fizz. The aroma is quite grainy with subtle pale malts and some vegetal hints. Sweet pale malts and grain is the main flavour with corn for added pleasure. Spritzy, aggressively carbonated. Geez, this makes you really bloated. Not good really.

Typical AHB product, pours urine color (but who actually pours it?), doesn’t really taste - certainly not for people who actually like beer, wantt hops? forget it, perhaps a small step up from Bud Light but it’s like comparing a douche and a turd sandwich

A great beer to sit around and drink during a baseball game or just at the house. Good clean flavors a clean finish, a great beer from AB. Great college kid beer(Me) Cheep with a good taste!! Great Beer!!!

A small step up from any other beer from AB.  At least it has clean flavors, but not really much flavor all in all.  What else can I say...oh yeah, it’s usually cold.  Doesn’t suck, just isn’t very good.

...complete shit, just like bud, just a slightly more watered down version of an already shitty beer.  I guess it’s for peple who like to act like they are on a diet or something, other than that, there is no point to drink this.

It’s hard to give this beer a "good" rating b/c there’s not much to it.  Sometimes you’re just thirsty and want a beer.  This is the one that goes down easy and clean that doesn’t cost an arm and a leg.
It sucks...I’d rather drink club soda for a buzz, flavor, color, and taste!!!
a step up from the normal bu or budlight.  It what i get when i go to a crappy sports bar on campus just cause its cheap.  But if i will drink bud, it will be this one.
your average mainline beer that is sold to the unintiated masses that just want a beer

Drank this beer straight drom the bottle. This beer has less flavor than water. Waste of time if you actually like beer. Its obvious that everyone that drinks this beer is brainwashed at a young age to love anything AHB. creates. I bet AHB. could sell piss in a bottle by having Justin Timberlake or JZ promoting it.

Pale yellow, 1 inch head. Ice and hoppy aroma and flavor. Flavor is sweet and tastes a bit like apple juice. Good brew maybe better than mic ultra. Good bite. A well balanced flavor of malt and hops and not too heavy. Clean finish. Good carbonation. I think this is my beer. Wait, no it isn’t. This is Budweiser Ultra.

I can not tell what Bud did  different  other then the label. It tastes like Budweiser minus hops. I keep hearing that commercial about Bud quality and it drives me cazy.  No taste no character, just alot of commercials.

First let me mention this can was about five months old according to the "born-on" date so that could be why I consider this a drain-pour. Metallic aroma, poured O.K. from the 16 ounce can into a clear beer glass. Small white head atop a pale yellow liquid. Taste is metallic, slightly sweet, leather, and downright unpleasant. No hops in detected. 
Palate was water.
Overall I wouldn’t give this to a friend under any circumstances. O.K. maybe if we were in the desert and had no water. But he would still curse me while he drank it.
good if you need to rehydrate at the river. low alcohol. low flavor. high carbonation.
This beer stinks. I don’t know what is really "select" about this, it tastes just like all the other crap Anheuser-Busch puts out. Gross
Pours a translucent yellow with a bubbly lacing white head.  Aroma of rice, floral notes, light citrus and cherrios.  Flavor of rice, cereal grains, grass, corn and some light lemon.

May 2007 - Pale yellow with a fizzy head that appeared and disappeared similar to a cola head. Weak aroma of corn and malt. Flavor was sickly sweet malt and corn with an odd metallic offtaste. Not worth the calories to finish.

There is a notable difference in taste between Select and Bud Light, but it is not statistically significant.  Thankfully, A-B has found a way to charge the same retail price for both.  Impressive ad campaign though.  Ok, maybe not.
A-B did pretty good with this beer, unfortunately, i’m not a big Budweiser fan. It’s still not bad.

this is a very good representation from a-b. i truly like this brew. when you drink more than a few of them it doesn’t loose it’s flavor. it still reminds your palate that you’re drinking a select brew. has a nice golden wheat look to it and when served has a very nice thick head on it. very fragrant.
it is what it is.  great when drinking 37 of them!  No taste or flavor.  I do find this (miller, budlight etc) refreshing after a hot day, but that is it
Zooted up (read: more heavily marketed) version of Bud Light. Great for beer pong so my partner, General66, doesn’t puke.
i hate that i have to give this a 0.5, i wish it could be lower. this is terrible. i only drank it because it was free. no taste at all

Terrible. I don’t know who the hell selected this, but they should be shot. Why not just go with PBR for that matter? This is a step above Bud, but still the same watery Lager we all know and love. This beer remind me of Jughead, with the crown on the bottle and all. Anything that reminds me of Archie is just terrible. Wheres Moose when you need him?

12oz Bottle: I got to try this sweetness in some kind of steel bottle meant to distract me from the contents.  Thankfully I managed to rate off a sip of someone else’s and didn’t waste money on it myself.  Try as I might I couldn’t differentiate between Bud Select and Bud Proper, nor did I really try.  It’s yellow, it’s fizzy, and it tastes like watered down creamed corn.  Really, really watered down.  I shall select something else.
I didnt think Budwweiser could get any worse... until I tried this.  "Select" is just another marketing tag for another horrible beer.
I think it’s very comparable to Miller Lite, which I generally don’t have too much of a problem with.  Not that it’s good, but it’s not awful, really.  Pretty good when it’s really cold.

Basically the  Budweiser formula, but wth less salt, carbonation.Great , worth to try.It has a great aroma too, pale yellow body, outstanding extra-white head, salty, palate, but it quite doesnt leave a bad aftertaste.

Drank out of the bottle so didnt get a good look at it.  Tastes more or less like regular Bud.  Not sure what is "select" about it.  Drink it cold and for what it is.  Rice beer soda.  Nothing offensive about it so I wont go below 2.5.

Just got done drinking some real beer.  Decided to try this and see what happened.  As expected, it tastes like cold water compared to what I’ve had in the past.  I think if I were homeless, I would probably dump these bottles out and use them as a toilet so they would be put to better use.

12 oz bottle pours a very pale yellow body with a tiny white head that quickly disappears without lacing. Essentially no aroma here, but corn adjuncts are noted as it warms. Crisp carbonation tries to enliven the light body. Taste is weak, akin to tonic water. Maybe some light grain noted. Creamed corn notes appear as it warms. Very disappointing.
