Not very discernable from regular Bud, not anything special at all. Just Bud trying to dress up a bad beer
Basically the same as bud light.  This just has slightly (as in unnoticable) more hops and flavor.  Definitely a redneck’s way of drinking classy.

This beer is much better than Bud Light.  Although still lacking much taste when compared to similar pale lagers (ex: Rolling Rock), it’s not the worst.  And even though I never really care about the calories when I have a brew, at least you can feel kind of good about drinking a beer with only 99 calories.  I’d take it on a hot summer day or with food.
On tap at some dive bar in Ft. Myers, Florida-Thin, watery, flavorless beer with no hop presence and hardly a malt bill.  Refreshing in hot Florida sun.  Too bad I was in air conditioned bar.

12-12-07 bottle. 

Oooh, this is a bad one.  My goodness.  it smells, looks, and seems to taste like watery urine.  Yikes!  I get so much disgusting corn in the flavor it is quite frightening!

Pours a pale straw color with a decent head that dissipates and leaves a spotty lacing. Smell is of cream corn maybe, yeast, alcohol, it just doesn’t smell the least bit enticing. Taste is better than smell, but that isn’t saying much, very bland flavor, it has a corn flavor, but it’s very watery. Mouthfeel is very light, I would rate it higher but the carbonation is way too high. Honestly it’s pretty easy to drink, it’s not necessarily bad, but it just isn’t that good either.
A very watered down beer that goes down smooth and tastes ok.  Very pale color with a medium head that dies down quickly.  Should be limited to backyard BBQs, tailgates, and house parties.

Well, I believe this is the better beer they have made...Taste has improved, color improved, better use of malts and hops. Not as watery as it’s brother. Nicely carbonated. Head is white and thin, goes away quickly. This is how the original should have tasted.

Couldn’t even begin to count how many times I’ve had this (being in college and all), I just never got around to rating it.  Aroma is watery, grainy, not really any better than Bud or Bud Light.  Appearance is only slightly darker than most pale lagers out there.  Doesn’t taste like much, but its more palatable than anything else they make.

Had at the company Christmas Party as it was the only beer available at the bar that I hadn’t rated.  Smell was an average pale lager like malt and yeast.  Drank out of the bottle, but assuming it was pale clear yellow like all other pale lagers mostly.  Taste was a definite corn like sweet malt, moderate bitterness for the style, and moderate to high carbonation.  Very drinkable, especially out of the bottle. and actually I thought it was worthy of much better than the bottom 5% of the lowest style of beer.  No bad or off flavors really.  Just bland corn, crisp malt.
why am I rating this.....oh yeah, so I can get my stats up....thats about it.  I drink this if I’m trying to lose weight.
The beer has no flavour at all. What little taste there is disappears from the palate fast. A highly carbonated product as well.

Not AB’s best effort here.  I guess it’s supposed to be a dieter’s beer with the low calories and all but I didn’t really like this one.

It looks fairly decent with its color but the bottle I had was carbonated as all get out.  It fizzed and bubbled forever.

Kind of hoppy and malty, but very dumbed down here.  Definitely marketed to the masses.

I won’t be looking for this one again.
Can’t even remember if I had this on bottle or can. That’s how much impression it made.
didnt like this 1 at all tasted real chemicaly was smooth but the taste was bland the scent was strange hard to discrib
Bud Light part 2 (like the New Coke). It is almost the same carbonated alcohlic water, only that have a notch more flavor....
Definate diff. to other Buds; doesnt have a grimy/slimy aftertaste, yet taste becomes quite stale after a couple.  Great beer in low quanities and cold; pretty refreshing.

Light-gold body, with a thin, yet somewhat lacing head. Mild, sweet malt and tangy hop aroma. The flavor is much like the aroma, but it’s more pronounced in the finish. Good carbonation. This would be a pretty nice beer if the flavor and aroma were "kicked up a notch," but then it probably wouldn’t be a light beer. All in all, this isn’t a bad choice if you want a very light lager.
Select? You can’t polish a turd. And this is exactly what it tastes like. Ummm a bottle of turds.

24-Oct-07 (12 oz bottle: BevMo in La Jolla, CA) There’s really nothing to this beer other than a distinctive sweet apple flavor and aroma.  The malt seems non-existent, not even any hints of corn or grain.  Hops doesn’t even appear to be an ingredient.  It’s just sweet to the nose and on the palate and tastes like an overripe Golden Delicious apple.  That makes the beer extremely easy to drink because there is nothing sharp and there is no aftertaste.  However, it’s decidedly not easy to drink more than half a glass because the sweet, apple flavor gets annoying very quickly.  More dryness on the palate and a hint of bitterness would really help.  Body is thin and watery, and carbonation is medium.  Medium straw in color with perfect clarity.  Quarter inch of bubbly white head settles to a thin, almost filmy layer.  Carbonation bubbles are quite large initially, but tiny ones continue to rise for the duration of the session.  Overall, it’s not awful because there’s hardly any flavor, but it tastes more like a watered down apple drink than actual beer.

I would rate it lower if I could. Immitation beer at its finest, and a wonderful example of capitalism in action, that is, making the cheapest product possible and selling for highest price market will allow. Acquisition wholesale cost = 25 cents, sells for $2.50 and up at restaurants. Calling this thing beer is disrepectful to the word, and the entire concept of the tradition.
Smells of yeast and mildew.  Pours nicely down the sink but don’t waste a clean glass on this one.  No hop - no malt and much water.  I am sorry I every tried this yeast water.
I fail to see any difference between the taste of Budweiser and Select. Different label is all I’m getting. A mass produced beer is all you can say.

Had this beer at Grants Farm in St Louis.  This by far is the most disapointing beer I have had from AB.  I might as well drink a glass of yellow water.  Dont know what else to tell you here but if you are looking to drink in quanity than this may be your beer
12 ounce bottle. Classic  macro brew product for less than $1.00 not worth a comment.
Not bad. it’s good cold. it’s better than any of their other buds. i like the bottle it comes in

Never expected to get a rating at last nights Ducks Unlimited banquet, but alas, I did.  The guy in front of me in line said: "oh yeah man thats good beer!"  Right....It smells looks and tastes like budweiser, but its thinner.  And it was "so good" that I switched to Skyy on the rocks after drinking it.

12 ounce bottle at a restaurant. Pale golden with ecent sized head. Not much aroma. Taste was a pale lager with some lemon and citrus notes. I was surprised by this one. It was not horrible, just sort of bland.
I was expecting something closer to a real beer when i saw the word SELECT but once again i was denied. It’s just another bud.
not much for anything.  it reminded me of water, but i like water a lot more.  i just think that they have overextended themselves with this one
Drank it out of a can. It really wasnt all that bad cause its the closest thing to water ive ever drank. and i like water.  This is a beer for people who dont like beer.

Poured like Bud, smelled like Bud, didn’t taste like Bud, tasted worst.  Just my opinion- AB needed a new campaign beer with the microbrew phase-  the suits thought,"Hey, let’s use the left over wort and mash from a batch of Bud and run it again"...Voila, Bud Select.

Budweiser Select - what does the select mean?  "I select YOU to drink this beer" said my friend.  And there is a crown on the label - but what for?   So this is a low calorie beer - I guess halfway between a normal brew and a lite.  The aroma was better than expected, but the dry, insipid taste was worse than expected.  Didn’t Anheuser Busch once brew beers that had some flavor to them?
I think this was a little bit better than their normal lineup. It wasn’t anything to smile about either though.
This is pretty much a typical lager, but a bit better than all the other regular domestics to me.  This is probably the best thing budweiser has to offer.
If I can’t get reg bud at a football game I will get this.  Not that it is good just that it is available.
Pours a clear yellow color with a small white head.  The scent is of a light lager beer.  A very fizzy beer.

It is a typical yellowish-amber like any number of American lagers. Aroma is not strong and just a little malty. Flavor is OK, better than other mega-brewed light lagers, but that is not saying much! Smooth, not complex, it is a good party beer but not much fun for a serious connoisseur.
Tastes like water, but not in the bad way.  No distinct smell, and doesn’t look terrible.  Not much to say pro or con.

Sampled from the bottle.  The color is a clear gold, with a very small white head.  It’s aroma is mostly hops, a bit of adjuncts, corny and grainy hops, basically no hops.  The flavor is mostly sour, with some bitterness; not sweet at all.  Not bad on the palate, some decent fizzyness, but fairly light and smooth.  I think I may actually prefer regular Bud to this beer, but I wonder if there is even a difference.
This is not as harsh a bud, and its usually a little cheaper. Good hot summer day brew.

On tap at the Cards game.  Poured clear bright golden with rising carbonation plus a dusting and a ring of white head.  There wasn’t much to the aroma.. light, sweet pale malts and a tuft of wheat.  Flavor was of dry pale malts and some mild light fruits at the core if you really strain.. very light floral bitterness.. watery on the back-end.. the epitome of non-offensive.  Light-bodied and watery on the palate.. too crisp and clean.. left a dry, grainy bitterness on the finish.

Bottle with "born on" date of 24 Jul 07.  I am treating this one no differently than any of the other beers I sample.  No foregone conclusions!  Pours yellow with a lively carbonation that contines through the session.  Smells clean and fresh but no aroma of hops or malts that I can make out.  Light mouth feel.  Rather watery and a beer that makes me burp after just one sip!  Goes down fast.  Better than Budweiser regular.  $4.99 a six pack in my area.
"Select", yeah right. I had one and had a hard time drinking it. Too expensive and not appealing to drink.
Bottle, what the hell is wrong with me I was actually gagging when trying to drink this one. reminds me of a watered down malt liquor, nasty
Bottle.  Amazed that Budweiser could taste any worse but it’s possible.  Watery taste.
Budweiser made even worse. No real taste beyond a sweetness and water. Not good.
I rather enjoy this beverage. For a domestic beer it is pretty good but not great. I wouldn’t get this unless at a ball game or something similar.
Looks, smells, tastes like the Bud family, but I never liked it b/c it was always prickly in my mouth.  At least Bud Light has a little more flavor...

Better than regular Bud is the best thing I can say about this stuff, but that’s like saying getting kicked in the nuts by Scarlett Johanssen is better than getting kicked in the nuts by anybody else.  You’re still rolling around on the ground, cradling your junk, and crying.
Keep going! Budwweiser’s attempt to make a better, almost decent beer. They still need to keep working on it! almost half way there.
I don’t hate drinking this.  It is better then regular bud.  Well balanced  and smooth.  Has a slightly bitter taste.  It is low in calories so its almost a health drink...right.
Almost identical to regular Budweiser- lack of aroma, taste, and body but slightly more smooth than the regular variety.
Budweiser at its finest.  Crisp and refreshing on a summers day.  Very easy drinking.  The flavor is alcohol and and a few hops.  An OK beer.
i really enjoy this beer, pretty much the same flavor with less carbs.   its cheap too.

Bottle at a Poker game.  I was all about this beer 2 years ago.  My palate must have changed.  I like the crisp light flavor, which has more flavor then the other light beers I have drank.  It is a better beer for the mass produced, but not worth the price.  If it is free, and you have a choice among the other mass beers.....

Draft and Bottle at Sea World. When questioning the AB reps about their goal they admitted they were trying hard to make a low calorie beer that still had some flavor and this was an attempt to combat Miller Lite. Well, they failed at the flavor part but apparently did pretty well on the low calorie part. It is typically flavorless but has a nice crisp clean finish and drinks as easily as water. I expect it will do well with the non beer loving beer drinkers just as most pale lagers do. It is not for me though......i’ll take the calories as punishment for good taste.

Some American relatives brought up a case of this on the weekend. Smells like a faint vodka perfume. Tastes like this same diluted perfume. Almost no body. It saves a few points, however, because I could still drink  these in succession.

Had while on vacation where my other options were bud light or miller light...This was very drinkable on a hot day, and much better then a regular bud. However, thats about all I can say about it. No distinguishable flavors here at all.

Not as bad as others say it is, but still pretty bad.  Better than Budwesier, though.  It’s too fizzy, WAY overcarbonated, and has no taste of hops or malt.  I’m not sure what to say, except the aluminum bottle is pretty cool, and it’d be OK if I were at a tailgate and the only options were it or Bud Light.

Came back with a full bottle from a "couples" wedding shower, we drank all the Blvd Pale Ale and this was the next best option, or was it? At home in a Bud Shaker (stolen from some college bar, I would guess). The beer is a brillant straw color with an assload of carbonation and a big ’ol white head. Sure looks like a BMC. Aroma is amazing for the simple fact that it is almost etirley devoid of an aroma. If I had to describe the smell, it would be light malt and some corniness, maybe a touch of earthy, spicy hops WAY back in the mix. Initial taste is all carbonated sweetness followed by some light malt/corn/ light biscut with a balanced finish. The low final gravity helps the balance of the beer. The beer is easy to drink since it is clean and well attenuated, but the sheer lack of flavor makes this a beer for someone that doesn’t care for "beer" flavors.
This beer looks, smells and, tastes the same as Budweiser but lacks that corny aftertaste.

wow, had this side by side with a corona.identical pale yellow color,same thin white head,very similar aroma,corn malt.same after taste.the bud may have a slightly crisper finish.some one could sue. nothing great.
I have nothing to say about this other than the fact that I have had water with more taste. This is a drainpour for defaming the good name of beer.

Looked like a good beer, smelled good....tasted horrid...I was on a ski trip and set this beer outside in 28 degree weather...b/c i thought the beer was warm...but it still was horrible after letting in chill as I skied, then got off the lift walked over to my porch, drank one, and went back down the slope...
Another canoe beer, close to water.  Not offensive, but I would never select this beer.
Water almost all of it. I don’t rated it worse because as a drinkable entity was fine. Just not a beer.

24 oz. can. Light grassy hop aroma. Very pale gold color with a quite respectable white head. Thin to medium bodied. Mild carbonation. A lightly sweet malt flavor, balanced by a hint of light citrus? Not really any bitter. It is clean, not buying into crisp. It’s different.
Tasted like carbonated rice or corn juice.  OK with a plate of hot wings but couldn’t get past the corn flavor.

I was at my local pub last weekend and an AB rep was going to each table and foisting 16 ounce aluminum bottles of this stuff on unwary patrons.  One taste confirmed my suspicion - AB has hit rock bottom and decided to keep digging.  Odd off-malt flavor.  No hops.  Strange finish, like burnt rice.  Awful.  This is the worst beer I’ve ever had, and I’ve had some doozies.  I couldn’t even finish one.  If I could have given it a zero, I would have.  At least the bottle was pretty cool.

Yes, really, they made me do it (drink more and enjoy it less thanks to OldCs mini tour).  Drank out of bottle but I’m guessing pale golden and no head per the routine.  Very light nose and surprisingly mild (very mild) sweet but nothing distinct (guess you can’t smell the rice or this is what rice is supposed to smell like).  Typical mass market flavor (or lack thereof) and similar but milder palate (less bitter than usual) and clean... but still a Bud.
Lies within the rankings of Michelob and Budweiser, I like the inicial flavor, yet nothing realy special, no outspoken flavors. no complexity.

Bottle, from Duvel tulip, a bit cooler than cellar temp. Born on 27MAR07. Looks like Bud. Smells like Bud. Tastes like Bud. This beer is literally indistinguishable from "non-select" Budweiser in every way, shape and form. I am at a loss to detect even the slightest difference. Perhaps if I had them both in front of me at the same time...ah, but that’s just crazy talk. Having never done a "proper" tasting of Bud Light, I have to assume that this is derived from it somehow, based on the alcohol content. My math sucks, but I believe if you mix 7 parts Bud Light with 1 part Budweiser, you get Budweiser Select. Rather than give an objective rating, I’ll just mirror my Bud numbers.
A better tasting beer than bud and bud light, but not as good as Coors. More hops but nothing really at all, just water.
I find this to be better than Bud or bud Light but not as good as Miller genuiune Draft among macrobeers.
Tastes like a mixture that’s 2 parts Bud Light and 1 part Bud.  Crap + Crap = Crap
not too great. better than bud, and not as good as bud light................

If you’re going to a party and want to drink a lot, then pick up some of these.  They’re really, really light in taste and they’re cheap, thus they make a good party beer.  But if you’re looking for a good tasting beer, don’t even try it.
Bud with a hint of wannabearealbeer... not much to brag about, but if i had to choose between bud and bud select... go for the select.
Budweiser with a little more flavor...what flavor I don’t know. Some more malt (maybe) and not as metallic. Blah either way
Better than bud light but maybe not as good as Budweiser but maybe, who knows...all the same watered down stuff.  WIll say its crisp however

This beer is pretty much carbonated water with some food coloring and a little piss added for flavoring.

My buddy screwed a girl that worked for AB last night after the bar. She was buying him these. Or more than likely swiping her AB credit card violating ABC laws and such. But due to the fact that he fucked her, I will rate this higher.

OK, what is different here?  What is "Select"?  Tastes pretty much like Miller Lite or Coors Lite.  Definitely better than Bud Lite, but that’s not saying much.  Just not much substance there.  Little flavor, thin-watery body.  Eh.
Dig the commercials but not the beer.  A clone of other Bud stuff.  A fairly typical macro type beer.

Pale pale yellow, white-as-snow head, surprisingly stays around. Light grainy aroma. Tastes of rice with hints of catpiss. Watery. No reason to drink this, and at 4.3% it’s hard even to get drunk on, assuming you can even finish one. Budweiser Select, meet Mr. Toilet :)

I love the fact this beer comes in a black tin 16 oz bottle.  I was expecting the worst but I was pleasantly surprised.  It might have helped that it was free during a beer society.  I am probably rating the apperance on the bottle than the beer itself.  When compared to other Budweiser beers, I will admit that I did not have to choke this bad boy down.  I will never buy this beer, but I will not be to disappointed if this is served at a pool party, or tailgating event, or at a picnic, or a kid’s 5th birthday.
This beer was free and delicious. It came in a sexy black, tin bottle (that’s right, tin!). I loved it, and so did the ladies at the bar.

Wow there are some people that really hat this beer!  I actually like it.  For a lager I thought it was really good.  The best aspects about it are the fact that when compared to a Coke, it has 2/3 the calories, less than 1/10 of the carbs, 0g of fat, and tastes good (I’m not saying that Coke tastes bad, I love Coke).  When poured sIowly and at an angle giving it a very small head, the taste is much better by far. Really don’t know why this is in the bottom 1%.  Maybe it’s because it is a domestic beer.  I drank this after a corona and thought that this was much better!  Drank straight from the bottle

okay. Simply put, i have to work my brain to believe there’s people who think this is what beer is actually supposed to taste like. I think i finished five sips. I do know that when i poured it into the beach, the crabs ran in fear.

Well, was at a club, the beer selection was downright bad, and these babies were only a dollar each.  Ok, I’ll give it a try.  I could say it was terrible, but that’s too easy.  For me, it was no worse and no better than most BMC products.  Doubtful I will choose this one again.

Had one of these while watching the Liddel - Jackson fight at a friend’s place.  From the highly revered "slim line can".  Very subtle nose of yeast, cologne, and flowers.  Pours a sparkling golden straw.  The mostly lasting creamy/rocky head leaves light lace.  The neutral flavor is slightly sweet and bisquity with a brief finish.  The light body is watery and lively.

THOUGHTS: Pretty good for a low carb beer that isn’t even marketed as such. Watery flavor. I used to drink a lot of Miller Lite when I tried to lose weith, but then this came out it took Miller’s place. This is a beer I buy when having company that normally drinks Corr’s Light and they usually enjoy it. One friend actually said he finally found a replacement for Coor’s Light. Now if I can only take him up a notch each time we hang out, maybe I can have him drinking Troegs Hopback amber by next year.
TECHNICAL: Bottle. Poure a clear, light yellow witha small to average white head that mostly diminished and left a little lacing. The aroma was light to moderate grassy hops. The initial flavor was lightly bitter and sour and the finish was moderately sweet and bitter and sour with a short duration. The body was light and watery with very fizzy carbonation and a lightly astringent finish.
Other than Bud Light, this is one of the worst beers on the market. It has the color of piss and taste worse. After two sips it loses all flavor other than sour metal.

Bottle. Born on date is 07MAR07. Pours blond with a small foamy white head. Nose seems to be pure cereal and soft hay. Very grainy. Taste is just as grainy and cereal laden but there’s some metallic notes in there. Body is very light and crisp while being rather refreshing, especially on a hot day like today. Ends with more grains, lighter hay and big cereal.
Bottle.Clear yellow.Corn aroma with a faint hint of grass.Tastes less offensive than the regular but,still not good
better than bud light but still not very good. pretty much the best the only "good" beer budweiser makes.

Rated 8/3/06:  Ah another nasty light/low-carb beer, yawn I’ve had tap water with more body and flavor than this. Aroma is stale gym socks, appearance is a respectable pale yellow with surprisingly good lacing and strong carbonation, mouthfeel is horrible, flavor isn’t too far behind tastes like beer flavored styrofoam, overall a poor beer.

All the ratings about bud select really has disappointed me. I have always been a budweiser drinker with other brands in between and when I tried bud select I thought it was awesome. It tastes the same as regular bud but without that after taste. A clean finish. Everyone that I hang out with drinks regular bud and I just don’t understand the top 50 list. no bud.
Pint bottle, Fargo. Pale golden colour, grassy wheat aroma. Slightly sweet flavor, very little else. Have had worse.
bottle.  Avg., white, fizzy head (mostly dissapating).  Clean aroma (nice way of saying nothing).  Lightly sweet water.  Decent carbonation.  Not good, but better than Bud light.
Overal it was better than it’s brothers bud and bud light, Not something I would go out of my for though.

On tap at Busch Stadium in St. Louis.  I guess I feel like qualifying the fact that I’m actually rating this beer in hopes that the Beer Gods don’t punish me.  I figure having it on tap at a Cards game is acceptable.  The pour was clear gold with slight copper tints.  Foamy white head.  Flavor was thin and watery but not the typical rotten corn mash you usually get from these mass produced beers.  Finished clean.  Actually kinda drinkable.
I like this better than Bud and certianly Bud Light.  Less metallic tanginess.  Tastes like nothing with with a dash of corn.
no one knows the difference with this and budwiesers other products, and thats how they want it.

Another beer at co-worker’s party. (Man! does he support A-B) Pours a pale golden yellow brew with a white head. Aroma of sweet popcorn w/o butter and salt. Taste is thin, watery, high carbonated with a clean finish. Ah man! how come I don’t have at least four model chicks surrounding me like they always show when an average  "joe" opens a bottle of Bud Select during those Budweiser TV commercials? What false advertising. After reviewing the commercial on my TIVO at least four times I did not see any fine print stating, "Event situation not typical" or anything like. I need to contact A-B legal dept about this.

12 oz. bottle- color of , pale gold , with a decent white head - nose of sweet corn , sour , very mild hops , malt , metallic , and bubblegum – taste of corn , sour , earthy (not the good type) , malt , and some bitterness - body is light (watery) , and with medium high  carbonation – aftertaste of grass , sweet /sour , and soap
Bottle.  Fancy marketing gimmick? What is the difference between this and Bud light?  It finishes clean, but unfortunately it starts clean too.

Draft. Pale yellow. Minimal white head. Peppy but not overpowering carbonation. Really not much to this except for a dry maltiness. I didn’t even know this was a "light" beer but my other choice was Miller Lite which I strangely hate. Not offensive in any way. Enjoyable in multiples. Good fuel for screaming at the bum relief pitcher who plunks the next batter on your team’s squad after a grand slam was hit. This beer is what it is and I’d drink it again.
A sweet tasting beer, hinted with a decent amount of hops and fruits.  It is a great low carb beer because the taste isnt too bad at all and it is easy to drink.

what was budweiser thinking? this shit is GROSS. regular Budweiser is AWESOME but this stuff is... well from start its colorful and has a vivid smooth taste that makes you say "hey this aint bad" sip 2 "hey this is kinda good" then on sip 3 as the reality of its shittiness sets in, you find yourself finishing it and saying "bartender, remind me to set this place on fire before i leave. you will get NO tip from me, just a middle finger and possibly a broken arm. thanks for not warning me BUTTHOLE"
a good attempt by budweiser. pours a bright yellow with little head. very easy to drink and like it the ad says finishes clean. the only low carb beer i like.
The only time anyone would drink this is if they wanted to get drunk. It is a very palatable beer so you can drink it fast.
nothing bad tasting and a typical american lager about what I expected when i ordered it from a pitiful selection.

If there were really a such thing as ’soda pop beer’, then this would be it.  Granted, it’s everywhere, and so is water.  No taste, no style, but an impressive flashy-shiny label.  Thank you, I won’t be buying this every again.

I had this one at the ballpark, they had run out of Brooklyn lager. It was light and bland. Light in hops, light in malt, light in every aspect. Inoffensive and unremarkable. A beer brewed by a committee: it offends no one, it pleases no one. Even the Nathan’s foot-long I had with it couldn’t help this one.
An improvement over bud light, but still tastes like a carbonate water mixed with piss.

Run of the mill beer-flavoured water. It’s like taking a half-decent pale lager, and mixing it with cabonated water in a beer:water ratio of 1:1. This is in no way above any other budweiser product. It’s utterly pathetic.
blech.  your basic water, with some light corn and lots of carbonation.  like sparkling water with come beer flavoring added to it.

Pours light golden with a fully receding white head and effervescent body. Aroma of very mild pale malts, ricey adjuncts, and metal. Taste is watery, cardboardy, and bland. Mouthfeel is thin bodied with fizzy carbonation. What was I expecting, this is a joke. Next please!

Not all its cracked up to be. Marketed to the LAte 20 something crowd, it leaves much to be desired.  I guess people feel lie they are getting a superior product, I disagree...  In act I prefer bud light...
Yuck! Taste like mineral water. If I was watching my "carbs" i would rather drink my spit than this crap!

alright honestly this is what is known as a extra light beer...   so for what it is its okay....  I mean it tastes like a natural light or a keystone light maybe even a bud light if you wish...  It looks like all those beers smells like all those beers and belongs in the one percentile of ratebeer.com.    i purchased 24 twelve ounce bottles today for 12.99 plus tax and had a pleasant beer drinking experience...  this beer isn’t one of the best selling beers in America because Americans have horrible beer taste...  it is one of the best selling beers in America because Americans are fat.
Very similar to Bud, more bitter, same aroma and very similar flavor, I do not see the coparison to micros, must keep trying brew

This beer has a very fizzy yet unappealing flavor to it. there pretty much is no flavor at all which is kind f sad when it is one of the most popular beers in america for slaes and mas appeal. It should probally be removed form liquior stores every where because of its lame attempt to be a flavorful beer
Uh .... not much taste to speak of, but it is inoffensive.. other than the lack of character I mean.  At least it isn’t metallic or tasting of festering pools of stewed corn.
I dunno how they got rid of the aftertastes, or why. Very weird not to taste a beer when you are done with it. I can’t think of anything really good to say.
Dude, they took the crappiest beer of all time and took away the afertaste, which was the only thing that lets you know its beer. It is positively piss.
From a 12 oz bottle. Poured light yellow.  Very watery.  No head.  Flavor is light malts and a hint of hops.  Not too bad for a light beer if you drink it really cold.
A Nose hint of sweetness.  Light, watery, some carbonation.  Very easy to drink.  Not as offensive of a taste as Bud.  Good for AB.  No hangovers.  Drink it when it’s free.
Holy frijoles! There’s biscuits a burnin’ in the kitchen...THERE’S BISCUITS A BURNIN’ IN THE KITCHEN!!!
like the low cals thats and the taste isnt bad the only bud i can drink and spend money on.
As compaired to the other A-B products this one gets my "I’ll drink it when it’s free" stamp of approval.
Bottle looks cool, and that’s  the only posative thing about this beer. Just a little more taste and abv than bud light. I dont think i will select this again.
This beer looks slightly more inviting than common Bud.  Otherwise, there’s no improvement.  More vulgar swill for a dying generation of drinkers.
What the... is this beer?  sniff sniff.. don’t smell like beer... certainly doesn’t taste like beer.... OHHH its a lite beer... I certainly wouldn’t select this again.

This one comes in a aluminium bottle, and thank you Michael for this present, even if it’s a beer that is difficult to describe with any positive words :) The aroma is thin with light notes of malt, the flavour is watery with a light perfume note. It’s not offending, but it’s one of the most boring beer, I ever tasted.

From a bottle...wow pretty watery especially after a samual smith imperial.  Just think this is there select beer as in elite budweiser.  Wow  distinct and flavorful...as the bottle says...not.  However if you first thought beer was beer then you probably like this beer, me... "not so much"
Sour aroma, apparently no hops, not very malty, llight color (yellow), hate to say it but it tastes like carbonated water with a sour aroma.

12 oz bottle. Pours yellow, with a small foamy head. Some lace. There was some citrus aroma, but mainly detected corn. Some bitterness as well as a slight metallic taste. Decent malt finish. Nothing special here.

Wow. I was suprised by this one. After Bud and Bud Light I wasnt expecting much, but it unlike the others, was not bad. Has the same yellow color, but the flavor is less harsh and the after taste is manageable. I would say this is the best AB product I’ve had so far. Would consider buying, if on sale.

Unlike some others on this site, I’m not above drinking an Anheuser-Busch product from time to time.  But come on, if you’re going to call yourself "Select," at least taste like something other than Bud Light.

Pours a clear unattractive yellow. Actually, calling it yellow is an insult to things yellow. After drinking better beers for the past couple decades, I can honestly say this beer looks sickly. Thin white head disappears almost instantly. Seriously bad American macrolager aroma. 
Very dry and thin cereal grain flavor. Nothing else. They call it clean and refreshing - I call it empty and disgusting. Mouthfeel similar to carbonated water, which is fine for water, but not for beer. This tastes like a Wheaties flavored carbonated water.

Im so glad this got rated lower than regular bud. This is because its a beer marketed as "select" which you would think is better than the regular bud. However, "select" must mean "scraps" beause that is what the beer tastes like even compared to bud. Good thing it costs about the same. Just as an example of how bad it is, it sat in my college dorm room for about 2 weeks before anyone touched it...yah....that bad.
From my cheap ass neighbors cooler. I knew what I was tasting before I had it but I had to try it. It’s watery BUD. Not much else to say.

Of the low carb/low calorie beers I’d take this one of mich ultra or coors aspen.  In fact, I’ll take this over bud lite. Why, because it has less carbonation, little to not taste, and no aftertaste.  I can drink this one all night and still feel skinny in the morning.  Can’t complain with that when its time to hit the bottle hard.
This is pretty awful stuff.  The people we sublet from left three of these in the fridge for us.  For free, I can’t complain, but I’d never pay money for this crap.
Almost pours clear, thin to no head at all, but actually tastier than Bud Light.
Lacking flavor and any aroma. Better than other american light beers, but not near the top of many lists
Very Watery, No trace of hops or barley.  decent fizzy, light, frothy, white head.  tastes like a little bit of beer mixed with water.

I got this as a joke christmas present, so i’ll give it its 5 seconds of fame. I’ll say this pours a bit nicer then regular bud, it at least can maintain a head on it, stays with a soft white head that reminds me of man-made snow, tiny little white bubbles over a ginger ale colored body. I’m not sure what this flavor they talk about on the bottle is about, I don’t really taste anything, so watery there isn’t really much malt flavor, and the hops? naw. They should say, "starts and finishes clean, almost as if you had never drunk anything."

No suprise - overcarbonated mess of a drink. Same fermented cereal taste of its namesake. Slightly sweeter than expected with no detectable hop presence. There is also kind of a wet-cardboard taste. Very thin bodied. Again - Heavily overcarbonated; its hard to distinguish whats in here because of it but I imagine there not much else.
Terrible. Most of the time there was literally no flavor. I did not enjoy this.
In my mother’s fridge.  What a disgusting smell.  Tastes like a watered down version of some sweet, hopped watered down yellow fizzy water.

I was sitting in a local tavern when I noticed this ’Select’ beer. It was new at the time so I decided to try it. One of the worst beers (if you want to call it that) I’ve ever wasted my time with. Why waste $2.50 when you can get a glass of water for free?

Another surprising light beer. Compared to Aspen Edge and Michelob Ultra, this is easily the best, due to some actual taste characteristics. There is a faint tinit of hops in there somewhere, but overall it’s still a light beer. Better than most "diet" beers, though.
Why would you "Select" this beer?  Considering the source, it has more flavor than most of their offerings.
Not bad for a AB product. Body was light to medium. Flavor was light but still better than a regular BUD
Slightly better tasting than Budweiser, less aftertaste, which makes it go down easier to get drunk.. Just another generic drunk beer
No aroma, couldn’t tell you about appearance, because a beer like this should only be had one way...right out of the can.  Made for mass consumption.  Just like any other AB product.
For a beer that is very low in carbs Budweiser Select tastes pretty admirable. Cheap and easy to drink like other light beers which conjure up memories of water...hah
Light, Light, Light, Skunk, and water.  This is not beer, it is something Borat would drink in his country.
Best of bud i’ve had so far. More hoppy but this is not necessarily good, kinda tastes skunked.

I have to give Am.Bush some cerdit for creating a beer taht is very low in carbs that still tastes pretty darn good, at least better than you would expect a low carb beer to taste. If you are drink beer in quantity and dont want the gut this is a good choice.

In the bottle. Served to me at Steph B’s wedding. Looks exactly like an Ab product, but might not be as awful as a regular Bud. Not a good beer, but it was a free beer. Seems a tad sweeter than Buttwiper, but not malt liquor swet. Plenty of rice still in this one. Just what is this latest gimmick of "long brewing" and how does it differ from "slow brewing"?
drinkalbe but i wont go much past that. an ok beer but for the price id go for old style or schlitz GET SURLY
Yeah, it’s a commercial piss brew, but it’s probably the best (least horrible) out of the bunch...no after taste whatsoever...if you’re into that...
Not too bad for a budweiser product.  Similar to a miller lite, Not much of anything.
I prefer this to most of the other mass-produced A/B products.  A cleaner taste without the awful aftertaste.
This beer stinks.  I don’t know what is really "select" about this, it tastes just like all the other crap Anheuser-Busch puts out.  Gross.

11/17/06:  Huge plastic cup @ The Black Keys show.
 Yellow body, no head, no lace.  Another icky version  from A-B.  The best part of this beer was the classy plastic cup… I would like to watch a small goldfish swim around in this mutha’.
just a more bitter version of bud, with a girble of more skunky hops...same dog differnt fleas
I am usually not a huge fan of the Budweiser family of beers, but this one is different.  I prefer this beer over Budweiser Original and Bud Light.

What is the goal here? My impression tucking into this was that I was in for the brewers attempt at something respectable (i.e. he "selected" this brew as something special). I’m an idiot for maintaining such lofty expectations. I’d have to try this side-by-side with regular Bud to be certain (and that ain’t gonna happen), but I’m pretty sure this is the same beer with a different label. And I made the grievous error of purchasing a supercan of this stuff!

I rarely rate an industrial macro but after an otherwise "normal" buddy mentioned that he liked this one, I thought I owed it a try.... now I owe him a whack on the head.  Pours a pale yellow and fizzy with a very short-lived white "head".  Standard skunky - though faint - aroma of grain.  Practically no flavor (and that’s a good thing because what little flavor there is is borderline offensive - adjunct-heavy and no hops).  Mouthfeel is no feel = water.  Finishes with no discernable effect on the toungue.  This stuff is just the latest in A-B’s spectacularly effective advertising-driven NASCAR/Wal-Mart cheap swill.

I am not a fan of bud, i’ll drink it if i have to and i won’t complain...to much, but this has to be there best attempt so far, What I LIKED about this beer is that you could just drink them, over and over; with out thinking about an "obvious taste" or bad after taste....This beer is made purely for the man or woman who wants to just drink beer and thats it!!! I had two 12 packs that lasted 2-3 days! me and my friends drank this crap like water, not because it was delicous, but because it has so little of everything in it! quite crazy! had again after about a year...crap crap crap...to fizzy tasting on the tongue, select must mean something different in st.louis because i think it means sour piss.

pours yellow with a two finger head and light body.small sweet taste not much else in taste and smell descent light beer better than bud light and any miller products.goes down smooth standard party beer.
Smells old/stale.  Very odd tasting beer, as if it was egineered in a lab.  Mich ultra much better (I geuss, if you had to drink it, especially when mowing the yard on a hot summer day).

On Tap at Lollapalooza.  The selection at the concert was poor so I went with this since I had never had it.  Just like bud light, but has a different name.  Pretty piss poor.  Typical macro pale lager.  Give me a break.  Pass.
i like light beer so its better than budweiser and especially better than its horrible brother bud light.  nice beer taste not to bitter goes down smooth

Poured from a can into my AB pilsner glass. Pale gold in color with a very thin white head.  Aroma is light with a touch of tart lemon and some corn-like notes.  Flavor is there, it tastes lightly lemony with a thin husky malt finish that is a little harsh, but not too offensive.  Nice and watery palate, exactly what a pale lager should be like.   Not what I like drinking, but at least I know what the commercials are referring to from now on.
this is worse than regular budweiser.  It seems like the "select" refers to them selecting the ingredients that were thrown out when making regular budweiser and using it to make this.

This is a fair light beer but it is what you would expect from a major mass producer. I had these in the 16 oz metal bottles that my brother won in a drawing at Hooters. I had 3 or 4 of these and woke up with the worst hangover. This is Kryptonite to beer drinkers.

This sucks just like most A-B products.  A low-carb, low-cal beer without the labeling.  Why does A-B make so much of basically the same product (Bud, Bud Light, Michelob, Michelob Light, Michelob Ultra, Michelob Ultra Amber)?  All pale lagers that deliver little or no taste nor satisfaction.
Pale yellow gold. Light aroma. Somewhat thin body with a grain flavor with light hops. Not very remarkable but drinkable. Clean mild finish.

Ok.  Let’s remember this is a low carb/low cal beer that doesn’t advertise it.  The AB commercials don’t help in this respect...full flavor?  What?  Take it for what it is.  All you dudes that won’t drink diet beer ’cos your significant other drinks bud light want to have somethin’ in your hand that looks like a regular beer.  Well, here it is.  No monikers of light or ultra.  Pours thin and pale, just like the people who drink it (or what they aspire to be).  More flavor than a bud light with half the carbs.  If you have too much taste, just chill it some more.  Thin palate that suggests corn over rice in the flavor.  Don’t buy over $12.99/24 bottles/cans for it.
is there really any difference between this and regular budweiser?  tastes the same to me.

WTF is this??  I say, this is just regular bud with a flashy label and an upscale marketing schtik.  Really, I could tell no difference between this and regular bud, except maybe this doesnt taste as "chemical."  Still a bad beer.

I gave this a slightly higher rating than the other AB products, because, well, I like it.  For an ultra light beer, its refreshing, and has a good taste.  Its crisp and refreshing, with a clean finish.  Good for hot weather.
12 oz bottle. Well, it IS slightly better than standard Bud. Yellowy gold with a white head. Weak ass watery malt flavor, seems almost devoid of hops. Select? Whatever.
On Tap at Big Foot Lounge in Memphis, TN.  This is what satan would laughingly offer you after a hot day in hell.  Will not select this again.

SHMEDLEY BEER TASTING 09-16-2006   Budweiser Select was the winner of our blind taste testing of 11 macros. That is not really saying much, but it did stand head and shoulders over Bud, Bud Ice, MGD, Labatt Ice, Molson Ice, Coors, Becks Light, Tecate, Amarit, and Heinekin Light. It had very light amber notes in its mostly yellow body, and there was a slight straw malt note in there. One thing it did have was a somewhat stable white head. I think I even tasted a hop.

I hate Budweiser, dont care much for Bud Light.... however this Bud Select tastes nothing like either of them. I am 36 and have stuck with the same beer for 15 years... until now. When I first tasted Bud Select (for free), I was totally impressed. Great Flavor and no bad aftertaste , unlike budweiser, makes Bud Select my current favorite beer of choice. Good Job AB!!!!

Draught. Clear golden color with foamy white head that left some lace on the glass. Light sprucy hop nose with a hint of pineapple. The piney hops are less prominent in the flavor. There is a subdued malty caramel note that lingers briefly at the end. Very watery. Eh.

12 oz. brown, longneck, twistoff bottle. Not much in aroma, flavor or mouthfeel. Very close to a certified drain pout.
What can I say, bud never seems to satisfy but, whatever, I got them for free so I cann’t complain too much

i chose this over the other A-Bs when i go out.  it has a mellow taste that never offends.  it’s lower on carbs so i can drink 20 of them and become only slightly less fatter and stupider for doing so.
C’mon now.  Budweiser is bad, Bud Light is even worse.  Why, why, why, did they have to come out with a beer that is supposed to be in between, but in fact is worse than both put together.  Ughh!!

Better than any of the other Bud brews in my opinion. Even though all this stuff is one half bud light one half bud regular. Seriously. I call this stuff Bud-between. Whatever, there is no need to describe the minimal characteristics that come out if you strain to find them. this stuff is bad and everyone knows it. but best offering from bud in my opinon so far.
Bottle. Too drunk to know, I tasted this and almost threwup. Why? Why do they do this? Your beer sucks don’t even try!
(Tap) Pours yellow without much head. Very bland and watered down. Just another poor macro beer.

Although different, it definitely falls within the spectrum of a mass produced beer and outside of what we can all instantly recognie as a quality craft beer. The hop mix is undecipherable (and a tad stinky) and mild, the malts show oxidadized characteristics. This is all on a thin, fizzy body.  I had hopes for this one. AB will get it right someday. Gallo, the Bud of wine figured out wine when consumer tastes evolved. Bud will do it, but this is not even close.
This beer is based more on a trend for the carb counters than anything else.  Although not totally worth counting out.  Drank it again just recently but definitely not my favorite.

Goes down easy, which is its high point. Has very little taste overall and no after taste. If anything there was a little corn flavor on its way down. I guess it does whats advertised, but not something I’m going to pick up on my own.
Worse than Michelob Ultra.  And that is really saying something.  I felt like I should be D.D. when I was drinking this.
on tap and free at Grant’s Farm St. Louis.  decent light amber color but not much else going on here.
Worst of the low carb beers I’ve to date. Pour yourself a half pint of bud, add two parts water, one part seltzer, and stir. There’s your extra long brewed bud select.

I realize this beer was a marketing gimmick to begin with, but even from the tap this is just terrible, bland at first, then a sickly corny, maybe the worst tasting 
beer in the A-B line, if you’re on a diet, you are better off giving up beer than drinking this swill.  Avoid when possible.

Clearly the best of the "big box" factory low carb/lite beers.  Above average flavor if served ice cold.  Not a serious beer and certainly not a beer you’d "brag" about in a taste comparison, but throughly competent for what it is -- a big volume, mass produced lite beer.

I must be a "homer".  Bud Select from that World famous brewery headquartered in St. Louis, MO is a very simple brew that does it’s job.  It offers a clean taste and is very refreshing on a hot and humid St. Louis summer day (or night)!

For all you "beer snobs" try drinking one of your Dark, Warm, Thick, Lagers during a day game at Busch Stadium then see how an Icy Cold Bud Select tastes!

Go Cards!

Wow.  People are pretty harsh on this beer. I’d love to put these beer snobs through some blind tastings.  Don’t get me wrong, this is a bad beer.  Plain and simple.  Licorice, cleaning product and water being the primary flavors.  I actually thought something was wrong with me.  Did my tastebuds burn off.  There is no flavor.  But there are lot of other beers out there that are far worse.
Of all the big brewery ultra lite beers, I do think this one is the best. Of course, that is not saying much.

:(     

I am torn on how to rate this. I want to give it a 0.5, but on the other hand, it’s too watery to be really offensive. I’ve had seltzer water with more flavor than this.
Watery, watery, watery. Weak. Takes 6-8 of them to get buzzed. Not worth the $9-10 (12-pk). Perfect for chicks and nancy boys.
Was bored in the airport...ok!?  Gold, fizzy white head.  Smelled like corn syrup and light pale malt.  Same crappy taste, very thin, watery, and bland everything.  Remained bored in the airport...
i hate that i have to give this a 0.5, i wish it could be lower. this is terrible. i only drank it because it was free. no taste at all
Not as good as budweiser, don’t really know why it exists.  Don’t waste your money unless there is nothing else.

Pours pale golden with a fairly decent white foam head that doesn’t stick around.  Mild corn and hop aroma.  Not much flavor, tastes like a non-alcohol beer - - mostly water.  Regular Budweiser actually has more flavor than this stuff.

Not as bad as I had expected but still not very good. Piss clear with a fizzy fake white head that vanishes. Not a huge adjunct aroma but it is still there. Flavor is much the same. In the end if ithe can is very cold I could stomach about 4 oz of this stuff.
Light Amber color.  Smell of malt and corn.  Taste of a smokey malty flavor that is watery and lite.
I also don’t understand what makes it "select". Basically it’s bud with less flavor. Can you imagine? Anyway, the whole 12 pack was less than $7 so I didn’t feel bad giving it away. Waste of time.

If you like Budweiser, which I personally do, then this is just a slightly watered down Budweiser with zero aftertaste. overall a pretty good beer. Definitely a great light beer, better than any i’ve had.

Bottle. Pours slightly darker than a regular Bud.There is not much of an aroma and not much there to taste.It does have a slight hop bite if you taste hard enough.If you want a beer with a lot of flavor ,then this beer is not for you.
How the hell is this stuff select?  It tastes worse than bud light.  I geuss it’s easy to drink, which is its only strong point.

my first mouthful wasn’t that good. Defintly needs more hops. If you are used to drinking bud or millers, I guess this would be flavorful. 1.35 for my 24 ounce can. I can see why people drink cases of this crap, goes down way to easy and very watery.
The only Bud product I’ll spend money on. I suggest skipping the Bud Light and picking this if you insist on an Anheuser-Busch prodcut.

This is a good beer to chug if you’re tired of Bud Light or PBR...seriously, that’s about all Bud Select is good for. Served cold, very little flavor at all...smells funny. Really just not worth purchasing.

This had a good head.Color was a golden amber.aroma was of faint hops.Tasted light and hoppy.From what I remember this is a bit better than the standard.It’s been so long since I had the standard beer.I won’t buy this again.
garbage i would say. i traditionally do not like the taste of any budweiser in general, and this newly marketed beer sucks.
a good hot day beer...it slides when grilling out ...and for some reason it makes my cock harder than normal after i go to bed at nite...whats in this stuff?
this one wasn’t too bad... by far one of the best they had at the beer school. my friends really didn’t like this one at all. i forgot what foods you  have to eat this one with....
For a garbage beer, it was better than I thought.  Doesn’t finish bad.  If your going to dring A-B it may as well be this one.
Smells like malted corn.  Vaguely light orange colour.  Tall unlasting head.  Tastes, to my great surprise, of nothing.  Flavour rating of 5 just for that.

Pale golden color with a frothy white head. Aroma of lightly sweet grain. Barely noticable flavor of light honey and hints of grain. The boring lack of taste is still better than the horrid taste of some of their other products.

Bottle from a fraternity borther -  A certain skunkiness to the nose; Bland initial taste; Boring backtaste; Slightly livlier than Bud Light, but just as horrible. There’s almost no discernable difference between this and Bud Light. Sad...I was hoping for something a little better than this.

If only the macrobreweries put money into the product and not just into marketing... As a bartender friend said today, you can complaiin, refuse to drink the macroswill, and promote decent beer all you want, but this crap will be here long after we are gone.
RIP.

This, literally, tastes like someone put out a cigarette in your bottle when you were in the can.  It reminded me of when I smoke with a cheap beer and the swig after the drag tastes the same as the cigarette.  Except I’m not smoking.  AB should be ashamed for promoting any kind of "select"ivity in regards to this swill.

Aluminum bottle. Had never tried it before and I figured I should if I’m going to sell it to people. This is just the slightest bit better (and I’m using that term soooo loosely) than Bud Light but it isn’t anything unique or different. It just has a fuller body to it and a slight sweetness. How AB can claim that this is somehow a "better" beer that their other crap is beyond me.
Nothing here, but you have to love the commercial. If I were writing it I would say" the best of Natty Bo and Molson Ice combined" or as Homer would say, "nuts and gum, together at last".

So there I was, standing in a Food Lion.  I hate Food Lion, but it was close to the house and we only needed a few staple items.  Then I saw it, a beer I had never sampled, glistening in the cooler section.  Let’s face it, we all make mistakes in life.  One of my mistakes was picking up this beer.  Light corn and sugar aroma.  Pale, pale yellow with fizzy bubbles.  Flavor, beyond a hint of corn, was almost non-existant.  Absolutely wretched.  No comparison to the Miller High Life I picked up as well.
Pale gold with a small with head. Yeasty aroma with the corny taste of the pale lagers. One I wouldn’t "Select" except to get another rating.

16 oz can.  Almost no aroma. Seltzer water with a splash of sour cereal malt.  Definitely a light beer. Its not terrible, its just useless.  Budweiser has got "crisp" all figured out.. Its the "flavor" that they either dont understand, or refuse to address.

12 oz. bottle. Went out to lunch yesterday and the choices were limited. Pours pale yellow with a white foamy  head that disppeared in about 2 sips. Tasted pretty much like Budweiser to me, same corn cereal aftertaste. I don’t see what A/B finds so "select" about this beer.

I was fooled by this one.  Neat lable.  It doesn’t say light on the label but it is the lightest of the  light beers.  Carbonated stagnate water.  
Aroma: none. Flavor:  Water with a splash of Bud Light.  I bought 12 and choked one down.  Need I say more.

I was at Yankee Stadium yesterday and choices were severely limited as usual. This is a bit more refined than regular bud; its almost like they added spritzer to give it a bubbly quality. A bottle of water is much better.

Bottled and Can,  I prefer this to the namkesake or bud light.  Has less of a taste than Budweiser, but doesn’t make me sit on the toilet the entire next day, and has more taste than Bud Light.  Overall, I drink this often and enjoy it, although mainly because I get them from my weight conscious friends when we drink together.

12oz bottle-A very light golden color w/a head that diminished quickly. A smell of a cheap beer from a can. No distinctive taste on any of the ends. Pretty much colored H2O. This beer has no flavor compared to Miller Lite. BAD
Well it wasn’t as awful as I was dreading.  Though there is little to report about this stuff.  There is nothing to it , it is not offensive, but again there is nothing there.

24 oz can.  I don’t know what they selected but it tastes like a Bud with some more character on the can.  Watery, cidery body, no aroma.  The non-existent flavour is perfectly balanced by the 4 IBUs of whatever hop oil they use.  Pretty crappy, and yet, I finished the can.

Very clear yellow with a merangue like head that dissipates very quickly.  Smells awfully, kind of like wet cardboard, its a very unique smell.  I’ve had bottled water with more taste than this, it tastes like flavorless carbonated water, which I have always claimed has a slight taste.  Slightly fizzy mouthfeel.  I think I’ll avoid this beer.  If you’re worried about calories and carbs, there are much tastier things to drink.  I gave this one point for not killing me.
Golden amber with white sudsy head. Smell was a very pungent sour malt. Taste was a light malt.
this beer is the long awaited competition for miller lite because it tastes very similiar but better.  Small creamy white head and very light, a must for light beer drinkers.

(Bottle 35,5 cl) Pilsener golden with a creamy, white head. Sweetish aroma of brewing cereal. Light and watery with sweetish notes of chicken fodder. No hops - of course. Is the "Select" term just a way of selling the same crap at a higher price? This is proof that wrapping a turd in glittering cellophane doesn’t necessarily make an acceptable package. Pathetic. 280306

This is probably the only version of Budweiser I really like.  It’s smooth and finishes clean with no aftertaste.  It’s not a beer you drink for strong flavor.  I get the feeling some people on here have to be overwhelmed by strong and complex flavors to enjoy a beer.  This one is just plain pleasant tasting to me, nothing more, nothing less.    To me, it feels like Budweiser’s version of Coors Light only with a bit more flavor.  I happen to like Coors light so it’s certainly something I don’t mind drinking.  Sometimes simplicity is more refreshing.

Am I drinking beer, or alka seltzer??  It can’t be alka seltzer, because my stomach is even MORE upset after injesting this paler than Casper, tasteless swill.  $15.00 US for a case is a rip off.  Budweiser asks me to "Select"??  I choose the toilet in which to dump it.  Many apologies to my sewer system.
Marketing garbage.  how the masses can be swayed is an amazing thing.  not tasty in teh least.  Price is bad too.

sorry mr. oberdorf, but this beer sucks.  i dont know how you or anybody can even tell the difference between it or any other shit in its neighborhood.  you need to graduate to the upper-lower-middle class beers of, for instance, sierra nevada caliber.
Sweet for Budweiser.  But it’s just another Bud Light to me... which the extra advertising and sweetness.  Nothing much else to say about this one.
nothing select about this beer, it even makes budweiser and bud light taste good, clever packaging and marketing make up for lack of flavor in their minds i guess
I had expectations that this would at least surpass Budweiser.  I guess I misunderstood the name.

From a bottle or a can, simply foul, offensive, overly carbonated crap - a Budweiser by any other name!  Pours flat and goes south from there.  Might be good as a drain cleaner - I’ll let you know how it works out.  CERTAINLY not meant for human consumption.

While not the most flavorful beer in the world, what flavor it has is quite offensive. Starts off with some over sweet fruitiness in the nose, and most of the brew tastes like light amounts of said fruitiness, soap, and wet cardboard. Mouthfeel is near seltzer-like. Regular Bud is more palettable than this.
total dissapointment. i thought this beer would be good but it has a horrible after taste, medium strength. i think it would fit better in the ’economy’ isle of kroger.

good for a light beer but otherwise just another budweiser piss beer, no good character but it does have much better flavor than any other american light beer. Which really just means it taste a little less like water then the others

Lacking macro in every way... Pours light yellow into the glass; aromas of sour grassy yeast.  No head of which to note, but it does leave a decent lacing.  Flavor is of tart corn, with a horrible watery mouthfeel and too much carbonation.  Leaves a plastic-macro aftertaste that’s not comforting.  I’m honestly rating it to get closer on my way to the 100 Beer Club, and unfortunately, I’m not due for a trip to the "Good Beer" store ’til next week.  1 more rating has been the most positive aspect about the whole experience.
I enjoy budweiser select more than bud light or regular budweiser, not that that really means anything

dark gold that is clear with a white head that went fast. minimal nose. acidic antilife taste that bristles my tongue. chewed paper flavorwith absolutely nothing in its favor besides its ability to drink like water to deliver alcohol, but really there are better ways to get alcohol if that is what you are after. think hard liquor and leave this crap alone.
If I have to drink a Budweiser give me this one.  More color and flavor than regular Bud.

A very week beer, i would say a mix of bud light and regular bud. Would drink any of the 3 if i was a teenager drinking a six pack to get a buzz or get drunk. It is very smooth (yes, like water) Obviously not for the hard core beer drinker but even for an average joe at a bar or resturant, there are better choices. Not horrible, its just there are better choices.

Tastes like all the other AB bottled water rpoducts.  Reminds me the most of Bud Dry.  I’m doubt anyone actually drinks this stuff because they enjoy the flavor.  It’s just water that will give you a buzz if you drink enough of it.
regular old bud with a couple drops of red food coloring. Dont waste your time, unless you like corn beer.
This is just another lable they slap on a light beer to get the average beer drinker to pay .25 more a six pack.
ah not terrible.  Fortunately I didn’t pay for it because a budweiser representative was at the local hams restaurant and gave me a free sample.  I do like free beer.

When poured from a 12 oz. bottle into a pint glass Select formed a nice white 3 finger tall head that hung around a few minutes.  Select is an absolutely clear straw colored beer with lots of carbonation.  Select is very inviting for its style.

There are no aromatic qualities to Select other than a slight astringent odor, not very pleasant.  So, don’t smell it, drink it.  That’s what it’s there for.

This is not really a beer you "take a deep sip of”, but rather guzzle.  There’s no real flavor here.  Select has hints of something sweet, but just hints.  

Select is crisp and clean on the palate and leaves no aftertaste.

This is a beer you can drink a lot of and since it is 3.2 grams of carbs. and 4.2% ABV you can do it a lot.
Note:  Now get this:  I drink Select because to me it has way more "flavor" than Mich Ultra and about the same as Aspen Edge and is cheaper than both.  The only thing Ultra and Edge have on Select is that they have 0.6 grams of carbs. less than Select.  Big whoop.

For a massively distributed, using non-premium ingrediants, this beer ain’t half bad.  I consider this to be the best brew in the Bud family, completely acceptable to drink on a hot summer day floatin down the river or after mowin the lawn.

I will give it this,it is non offensive,very definitely crisp and clean, I would drink this over water on a hot day,if served really cold the rice and corn flavor don’tcome out that bad.Served above 50 degrees,now your talking kraut juice

Im gonna have to say, this is an improvement over bud and bud lite.  Not the alcohol im looking for and I dont care about the low carbness.  i am not even sure this is in the direction i want good old bud to go.

Hey, not as crappy as I expected... still a bit on the watery side but that is pretty much the norm for a mainstream American light beer.  These aluminum bottles are a great idea for this type of beer as they must be kept ice cold.

Great refreshing beer!
Crisp taste, easy-going finish.
Lively head, great stuff!
Big time favorite.
Mmmmm. the finest hot garbage, aged in the sun for weeks....pissed on by the finest brewers in the land. Juiced in the jack la lane juicer and bottled for your drinking pleasure. enjoy.

Pours crystal clear- lively carbonation and the most pale yellow color I have ever seen. Head is pretty decent though.  Aroma is DMS, cooked corn, stale malts, wet cardboard, oxidation, mettalic-like, steely malt, corn, rice, - I can honestly say this smells way worse that original bud.  Flavor is almost non-existant when cold.  Whatever flavors do develop after warming are terrible.  Light paper- cardboard and crackery-malt.  Light biter finish - more like a metallic bitterness than an actual hop bitterness.  The world select is much better but both are pretty bland.  It is very easy to see why this is one of the lowest rated AB beers on this site.  Utter crap.

Color was as pale as urine after eight beers, even if you pour down the center like they suggest on their commericals the head still comes up flat & uninviting, the flavors & body are no different than the "original" Budweiser, tastes like overly-carbonated corn & stale rice, very bland, very watery, sickly finish & aftertaste reminding me of Halloween candy corn, an absolute embarrassment to all that is holy & beer-like

i had it in a can, i can only imagine its yellow just like other budweiser types. the first sip i had tasted like the first sip i had when i was like 7 and dad let me have some so i would never drink again. it was overly fizzy... like most cheap, mass produced american beer- but for what it is, it did have taste, unlike bud light, or miller lite, which just taste like water from a dogs bucket.

Dull straw body with a clean, sudsy white head and substantial carbonation that looks like an aerator in an aquarium. Fairly weak nose with adjunct signatures and clean, well-attenuated pale malt. Light flavor, but cleaner and drier than Budweiser. Very low bitterness and no hop profile to be found. Watery palate. Minimal character, just watery and otherwise inoffensive. Thirst-quencing anyway.

(draft @ Ford Field - Detroit, MI) It’s yellow, it’s rice, it’s sour, it’s Budweiser. It’s also bad and really dry. However, it was the Superbowl, and I figured what the hell. August, you lied to us all in your commercials. This beer isn’t crisp and it don’t finish clean.

It’s really not that bad.  Regular Budweiser tastes like crap in comparison, and I think Select tastes better then Bud Light.  Select is smooth, with no offensive smells or tastes.  I noticed the canned version isn’t as clean tasting as the bottled kind.  There’s better light beers out there, but this is easily the best of the Michelob Ultra/Aspen Edge “diet” beer crowd.

Beer is meant to serve one purpose and that is too get you drunk!!! Lets face it when it comes to the large brewers, Miller, Bud, Coors it is all crap.  If you can’t handle it than you shouldn’t be drinking.  So stop whining you pu**ies and just drink!!!!!!!
For some reason I thought this watery crap was a little better than Bud Light, but it’s still a barely there beer.  Lots of carbonation, some corn, some water... did I mention it’s watery?  Yeah.

Very light color-- not darker than reg Budweiser.  Finish is sweet, in an adjunct sort of way.  Not too bad for a macro-brewed, highly-advertised brew.  It actually comes together and evolves into a forgettable but smooth finish.  This is about $1 more per six pack over reg Budweiser, which makes this stuff an infinitely better deal than buying that horse swill.  It actually tastes somewhat compatible and refreshing in those flamboyant 16 oz aluminum "bottles."
Watery, metalic flavor.  Fizzy and disgusting.  A travesty.  I wish this company would just go away.
All you quit bitching you babys and drink up i liked it it wasnt bad definetly not the best but not the worst

Bottle from the Cheesecake Factory.  No aroma, probably due to the temperature at which it was served.  A mostly translucent orange color with  a bunch of bubbles.  All you taste is the alcohol and some sour grassy-ness.  Hyper-carbonated.

Very light tasting, smooth,and clean. Hints of bread or corn. Slight bitterness. Not much flavor.  For a moment, I thought I was drinking a new bottled water. There’s nothing offensive here, it’s not bad, just no flavor.
Wow.  This might be one of the worst beers I have ever had.  Budweiser managed to screw it up again.  There is no taste.  I think they just put bud light in a different bottle.
This is possibly the same beer as Budwesier. I notcie a more attracting aroma though but the flavor is bland and heavily watered down.

Can.  Aroma has lots of DMS with hints of stinky feet.  A bit grassy.  Pretty pungent.  Transparent light straw color with frothy white head.  Ovely carbonated spritzy corn-like flavor.  Finishes bland and watery and hops are lacking.  Can’t believe I paid $11 for a 12 pack of this shit.  Where are the finest American and Bavarian hops they advertise?

Well I feel like there is absolutely no aftertaste.  Whatsoever.  I don’t even use this beer for beer pong.  Flip cup, only maybe.  Beyond drinking games, I’d have to be really drunk to "indulge" in such.
wow, is this a beer.... I’m going to have to say I’d take an aquafina for 4 bucks over this tripe at any restaurant.
Pours a golden yellow color - aroma of corn, grains, and hops.  Little to no flavor or mouthfeel.  The finish is very clean... just like water.
If like to drink bottled water, then this is the light beer for you.  Great for tailgates, but must be drunk in large quanities.

not a good budweiser....pretty much just tastes like water.....i think that this was made to compete with miller lite or maybe even michelob ultra.....for some reason.....tasteless but i guess enought of it will get you plowed
Pours a golden yellow color.  Aromas of corn, grains, and a touch of hops.  Flavor is crisp, more appealing than regular bud.  Easier drinking.

This bottled brew poured a large sized head of foamy finely sized mostly diminishing white colored bubbles that left behind a fair lacing.  The body contained average carbonation, was transparent and straw yellow in color.  Its aroma contained notes of pungent dirty socks and malt.  Its mouth feel is initially tingly with a lingering  tingly palate.  Its flavor contained malt hop notes crisp and thin.  Do you know why Budweiser goes through your system so fast?   ....... It does not have to stolp to change colors!  Come on Anheuser-Busch make a good beer!
Nothing "select" about this one.  Definitely not for the premium bucks you have to sheel out.

This bud was free, thank goodness! A good beer to drink when you arent looking for flavor, but that could be any number of horrible beers. Small white head that dissolved quickly. Lots of carbonation, but next to nothing on the palate. Flavor was bland and this was definantly not worthy of a "select" title. Go for Coors or Miller over this stuff....
Urine color, with a brand taste better than most.  I would go for a Coors before going for this abomination of brewing.

Disclaimer: I didn’t pay money for this. Unremarkable pale lager appearance. Aroma is light bread, acetaldehyde and an acetic sourness.  A bit of a "footy" aroma as well.  More apple and complete lack of body and malt character in the flavor . Nothing is there on the palate. Honestly, I cannot tell the difference between this and regular old Bud.  Go for it if you like apple juice.

where the hell did my rating of this go, as i stated before i enjoyed this fine brew on sale at the coaster saloon at mission beach in san diego. Better than bud, but not as good as bud light if in fact you actually call bud light good.

The clears the 12-ounce brown bottle a limpid light gold color with a portly bright white frothy head, the lace a fine coating upon the glass. Archetypal lager nose, sweet malt and little else, start is lightly sweet with a light but present grain profile, the top light. Finish is strikingly acidic, the hops light but there at least, very dry aftertaste, in all fairness, and it is what it is an everyday lager
American Crap all the way......do i really need to explaun how much this beer sucks......way to go Bud....try better next time
Reminds me of a mix of Bud and Bud light.  I used to like both, but now I find them to be too watery, ,and thus, the same goes here.
Pours a light yellow with quick dminishing frothy white head.  Very watery.  Acidic aftertaste.  Dont waste your time.

The bottle poured a sparkling clear light gold beverage with a small fizzy white head that was mostly diminishing and left no lacing on the glass. The aroma had a subtle malt presence of baked bread and an almost undetectable yeast note of raw dough. The body was light with lively carbonation and a watery texture. The flavor started off lightly sweet, acidic and bitter all at the same time. The finish was short and had a slight astringency to it.
Ok I guess for what it is.  Better to have something with very little taste than something that tastes horrible.  That said, it’s a bit like making love in a canoe, if you take my meaning.
Watery beer-like stuff. Kind of like skim milk as it compares to whole milk, except worse because it’s not good for you at all.

Is this beer or hopp falvored seltzer water? I mean come on!? Let’s try to make something here that remotely resembles beer not just a fancy label and bottle housing urine. Honestly, you have to be drunk in order to enjoy this beer, because in any other state you are just harming yourself. STAY AWAY
Ok its bad, worse then bud bad. WEhcih is very bad however its still not as bad as Bud light. I guess that could be a new slogan
I think that this is probobly the king of the low carb beers.  I think I detected seltzer flavor.

Maybe if I tried a Budweiser Select and a Budweiser side-by-side I could tell the difference.  As it was though, I didn’t and I couldn’t.  It poured pale yellow and I swear you could smell the rice.  It had a fizzy taste and a green apple after-taste.  Yet another uninspired beer from AB.

bottle.  As far as I am aware this is the best bud has to offer.  Good for tying one on and not much else.  Drank a six pack with no real thoughts as to the complexity (mirth) of the beer and for that matter, no ill side affects other than the sinking feeling that I just dropped $5.49 on a cheap but not quite good time.  Its a good thing we have freinds to distract us from what we drink.

Did I get one of the few "decent" bottles?  I poured the beer into a pilsner glass and it actually looks nice.   Huge creamy, merengue-like white head and so-so lacing atop a watery golden body with tons of medium speed carbonation.  The aroma is stale cardboard and stale hops/malts.  Pitiful given the born on date was Sept. 26, 2005.  The flavor wasn’t offensive.  Pale malts and boring yeasts and grains.  Drinkable.  Palate is lingering and boring.
Can: You really have to wonder about the people working in AB, why would you take an already terrible Budweiser and make it even worse? Nice label.
Hard to give this a rating since it really didn’t taste much like anything at all.  Nothing spectacular at all, and leaves much to be desired, like many Busch beers  in my opinion.
less flavor than regular budweiser.  no flavor actually.  watered down.  smooth like water.  i probably wont select this again.
Well at least it was what I expected.  Fizzy and low on flavor.  Typical AB product that requires it be ice cold to consume.
Typical generic beer from the King of Beers.  Bland but clean; little character.
not a very good beer it has more floavor then bud and bud light but thats not saying much i could piss out something better than this beer.

out of the bottle. the color and consistency of apple juice. like bud light but medium-bodied, fuller than the lighter style.  some fruity flavors are mixed in. texture is less watery. medium-carbonation. I like this beer with chicken at Ted’s.

Stronger than the usual libations I drink, this has a really good full flavor that struck me.  Sampled it at a Jacksonville Jaguars game earlier this season and have had it several times since.  Very good for a non-light beer.
This beer is very similar to Bud Light but with an extra kick. Fine malt taste and refined hops make this beer a pleasure to drink.

Standard weak corny lager aroma. Sweet dullness, appeasing the beer drinker that doesn’t like the aroma of vibrant floral hops and subtle malt nuttiness. Sweeter than most pale lagers, and not as skunky as its European counterparts. The liquid was the color of dark fizzy apple juice, crystal clear with bubbles that arose to break on the flat, uncluttered surface. Soda fizz head vanished immediately. No lacing. Light watery body with medium fizziness, not quite as vibrant as soda. Starts with a minimum of taste. A mild sweet taste to begin, punctuated with carbonic tang and just a bit of hops. Wimpy, emasculated hops, but hops by name. The finish came so quickly after the start that I classify a sip as a non-event, and the aftertaste was minimal. No bitter beer face to be made of this beer, since there aren’t enough hop oils to get even a pucker. Dull corny notes. Glad I tried it, but don’t think I’ll ever have again.
Refreshing if you really need a beer, but I really prefer other beers most of the time.
If you like Bud Light, then you would probably like this.  I think that they are the same product, the only difference is the bottle!
