Bottle, born August 28, 2005;  actually this beer tasted like it was never born.  Pours pale yellow with a thin white edgy head, some lined lacing.  Potato corn malt and yeast (sweat) aroma with hay notes, background hops.  Bland watery malt flavor, essentially flavorless, with some hop notes.  Light and clean, smooth palate.  I drank this so I could give an honest opinion to my classmates when I do my presentation on A-B’s marketing of this new product; very poor opinion.

12 oz bottle. Pale straw color with a soapy white rapidly dissapating head.

Aroma is grain and cat pee. 

Flavor is..... uh what flavor? grainy aftertaste.
Select is a more tasty then Bud light but has the same calories of a light. It finishes clean with little after taste. For the availability and the price you can hardly beat it. It’s a solid beer.
on tap-pours a white head that reduces to thin, with patches of remaining thicker head.  Color is clear yellow.  Aroma is grain.  Taste is grain, good carbonation, watery.

Is "Select" the new "Ice"? Pale yellow and bubbly with a thin white head and minimal lacing. Faint musty hops aroma, or maybe I imagined it. Seltzer-water character with no real flavor present. Don’t they use the word "bold" somewhere in the advertising? Right. The finish is equally tasteless. This beer is DOA.

From the tap.  I cannot think why they call this "select".  The only flavors I could taste were faint corn, sugar, and that musty taste you get when the tap and lines haven’t been cleaned in years.  Dreadful.

Can.  Poured out a pale gold with a sudsy small white head.  Not much to the aroma at all.  The flavor is decent for a light beer, it is indeed crisp with a little bit of a hops.  Palate was thin, watery and a little fizzy as expected.  If I want to drink cheap and light, I would drink this again.  And it worked well with my beer can chicken receipe.

and this is different from Bud how??? I was in attendance for the baking of the largest pumpkin pie in the guiness book of world records (the city turned the outside basketball court into a stone oven) and anyway all that was left was Bud Select.  What a grainey corny disappointement.

Pour a budweiser and a bud light together and you’ve got it.  Thin, ricey flavor that gives me a headache and is an insult to the term beer.  If it’s this or Bud Light go with this, but I can’t think of another reason to drink it.  A feeble attempt to add hops to a beer brewed with rice turned out to be a joke.  Only way you like this product is if you like Bud in general, and generally dislike the taste of beer.

Tap. Not much head, but might be better poured. Aroma is a plesent hoppy scent, and is deep golden in color. Strong hoppy taste, not bad. I thought I would try this with an open mind, and it’s not bad for a light beer.
This beer is better out of a bottle than a can however its still not good. It is just Budlight with more taste, however not much more
I don’t like this beer I thought that it was way to carbonated. It’s just nothing special.
This, I believe, is the low carb version of Budweiser.  I had it in a can, ice cold.  It was refreshing.  Nothing more, nothing less.
So it’s budweiser, I can’t tell the difference between any of there crap light, slect, or whatever they wanna call it.

12 oz bottle, one of the few choices to go with a delicious grouper sandwich at a small restaurant in Bradenton Beach, FL.  Pours yellow-golden with a small white head that leaves just a bit of lace.  Aroma is lightly malty with tell-tale adjunct notes (corn and maybe rice) and just a bit of floral hops.  Flavor is also lightly sweet with the aforementioned bit of crisp floral hoppiness.  I have to admit that it was refreshing and a serviceable accompaniment to my sandwich, but if this is Budweisers select, then let me not choose as they choose again!  Thin body and plentiful carbonation.

Sampled from bottle, cold & free. The label reads "Distinct and Flavorful Beer with a Crisp Taste That Finishes Clean." While both crisp & clean, Select is by far the most distinctevly flavorless beers I have ever sampled. Pours brillant yellow-gold with a collared white head and not a trace of lacing. Aroma is faint and sour. Flavor is literally non-existant. Highly carbonated and watery.
Uggh, someone bought this for me today as a "favor." Very corn-y, sweet, but mostly tastes watery and undistinguishable.

Pale yellow with a head full of vapid, watery bubbles.  Nose a bit grainy.  Tastes mildly sweet, some rotting vegetables, adjuncts, and other things best defined as "crap".  Yeah, it’s better than MIchelob Ultra, but so is a rectal exam given by a drunken monkey.  Or so I’ve heard.

Bottle 12 oz. Given to me at a local bar/ rib place. Clear amber color with small white head that diminished quickly. Little aroma. Light body. Small flavor with a better finish than most  macro brews.
Had this out of the can, decent I suppose, too watery for my taste, maybe it would be better in bottles
Not bad beer, a little overrated.  I think its much much better out of the bottle.  I drank 2x4, and it was terrible.
The cheap beer you drink when you’re looking to sustain a buzz and your tastebuds are numb.  Kind of like beer.  Has alcohol in it.  More flavorful than Mich Ultra, but then again, so is water.

(20 oz can at the ballpark) Think Bud Light with delusions of adequacy. Pale gold, white head, a little grain aroma. And since it was at a ballgame, it wasn’t even that cold, so my tongue wasn’t numbed as a drank it.

I can’t believe this is their "good" offering.  "Distinct and Flavorful" my ass.  While this doens’t have the pungent damaged rice flavor of their other beers, this is immensely flavorless.  It has a super-quick burst of watery "flavor" that immediately dissolves into nothingness.  No flavor...heh, which is definately an improvement over the rest of the putrid swill that they make.
Slightly better than the rest of the budwieser family, actually the only one I can even stomach.  It has a smooth finish but a slightly sour heady initial taste.

Slightly better the regular bud... which is like saying a retarded kid is better than someone at golf....  it’s not saying much..  it is the exact same taste as bud with a slight bit more body,  but not much.  Large American breweries have it so wrong...

shotgunned out of a 12oz can.  i put it down so fast i didnt realy taste much just bad cheap easy to make beer.  not very good.  if bud was trying to make the perfect bonging and shotgunning beer they nailed it with this attempt.

Head is initially small, frothy, white, mostly diminishing.
Body is clear light yellow.

Aroma is lightly malty (grain), with light notes of plastic, DMS, and paint thinner.

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, lightly bitter, slightly unclean.

Light body, watery texture, fizzy carbonation.

How have we sunk so low to call this beer?  This literally seems like what you would get if you steeped grains in carbonated water for a little while...hardly any color, aroma, or flavor at all, but what little there is is unpleasant.

I think the "select" in the name must mean that they only selected certain ingredients from their usual recipe for Bud.  It appears that they did not select any malt or hops in this formulation.  Though they have a bit of a golden hue to their yellow, with much much carbonation billowing up in a starchy head, the aroma has a blend of vinegar and chemicals, and then the flavor suggested notes reminiscent of sake, which makes me think there is some rice here....  Not particularly sweet, to my surprise, and it was really watery in the finish, despite the showy display of carbonation on the pour.  Pretty mediocre, though I don’t think this is as bad as the current 1.25 rating would suggest.  Just 2.0 kind of bad.  Bottle.

Sampler from Beer School at Sea World San Antonio. Poured yellow fizzy with a white head.  Hey, the marketing department sees a fad in America, this low-carb thing. So let’s jump on the bandwagon, make something that has more flavor than Bud Light, but not as many calories as The King.  Let’s call it Bud Select. Yes folks, your friendly marketing department at work. Get it while you can, low-carb fad is dying, and this beer will die with it. Nothing much to say about it, other than it was yellower and a little more flavor than Bud Light (almost... peppery flavor), but not quite as much yellowy goodness (LOL) as Budweiser.

I guess everybody has to have thier fair share of every new market.  Not much to speak of here, besides, its all been said before, corn flavors, watered-down taste, blah blah, blah.  At least I’m not getting fat tonight.

Can.  A slight hint of sour malt.  Light golden yellow but with a surprisingly large head.  Slight hint of malt if it’s your first beer but then more like Perrier.  Just a tad bit better than Michelob Ultra.
This tastes like a cross between Bud Light and Heineken that has gone bad.  Light color, almost no head, reminds me of all the other Big 3 light beers with a more sour taste.

I really enjoy this beer. Light, crisp refreshing.  Almost as good as Coors light.  For a normal priced beer, it’s good.  You can drink a lot without getting to drunk. It’s low calorie and it is easy to drink.

Bottle. Small white head that mostly diminished, fine-small sized bubbles, sparse lacing, carbonated, transparent, and a yellow hue. Aroma was malty as was the flavor. Tingly mouthfeel. Light body. Enough said.
Bottled.  How in the hell is this different from regular Bud?  Same ol’ swill if you ask me.
someone gave me a can.  Sour aroma - but nice light refreshing color.  taste just isn’t their - -no flavor.  It’s dry but not crisp and finishes slightly bitter.  I’ll select to never buy this beer.

Well, it’s better than regular Bud - at least there’s that! It was fresh and clean and crisp, but it was fresh, clean, crisp Bud! I’d drink it in a pinch, but I’d be wishing the entire time that it was a Yard’s Phila Pale Ale.
Beer for the non beer drinker because it has a beer fortaste but water after taste.  Anheuser-Busch finally did it that made a crappier beer then bud.

normally i wouldnt rate the swill, however i would rate it if i was in a foreign country, and i went on the anheuser busch tour while in st louis and indulged in all the busch beers i had never tried for free.  so here we go.
not much different from the bud, slightly more bitterness but way more co2 on draft.
Thin and watery.  Unpleasant alcohol nose.  Bad corn and chemical flavors.  Awful.

Spritzer beer!  No kidding!  It tastes like spritzer.  I love sprizter!  Alcoholic fizzy water.  What more can you ask for?  I also hear it’s got digestive enzymes buried in it too -- makes for a great after dinner spritz.

Bought  this by accident at a baseball game, thinking it was Budweiser (I will NOT shell out the money for decent beer at ballpark prices). One word: water. If this was the only beer in the world, I might never drink beer again. I can find no words to express its badness... it’s worse than Natural Light, easily.

I was on the golf course the other day and the beer cart drives by and I was feeling a bit parched.  The selection of beers in the beer cart is rather limited.  I decided I’d try the Budweiser Select.  The girl driving the beer cart gave the following recommendation, "It’s good, it finishes crisp."  
I found this beer to be very similar to the story above, pointless.

Maybe one day, A-B will make a beer that’s worthy of drinking, this is not the one. Smells putrid of cheap white wine, taste like club soda with a little bit of beer in it.  Clean tasting: Yes.  Good tasting: No

Avoid at all cost, drink water instead of this.
wow, I was surprised that this was so bad. I expected an improved budweiser, but it came off as a bit skunky and had a weird malt character. Thin, watery, blah.
Much like if Chinese white rice and vegetables were harshly mashed and fermented.  Agonizing aftertaste.  Rice, rice, rice baby, all over the flava.  Weird beer, overdominates your buds.
Please, I hate I’m wasting time even rating this beer.   Water Period.  There are better swill out there.
water+alcohol......the end. Noth much else to say about this one, except it has a pretty label.

tasted like soda water.  basically a bar could take a shot of cheap vodka, pour it into the bottle and top with carbonated water and patrons probably would not know the difference.  better stick some food coloring in just in case of a spill though because a customer got really excited about the low carbs!  this beer does serve its purpose--cool packaging, very little taste and if you drink enough of it you will probably get a buzz.

Not offensive, but doesn’t stand out from any other macroswill. This reminds me a lot of carbonated mineral water, except that the minerals in mineral water are stronger than the hops in this "beer." 
This crap will quench your thrist, but so does water.
i think this is better then regular budweiser.  It kinda taste like miller light but with more flavor.  Has a bit of sweet taste.  Wasn’t watery or thin like i expected.

Off aroma almost skunk like.  Pours a very pale yellow, watered down in appearance.  White foamy head that disappears almost immediately.  Grainy, watery, with very little bitterness to the taste.  Very light body and no aftertaste or mouthfeel.
Yeah, I’m not gonna spend too much time on this. Ugly yellow coloring, with way too much head and carbonation. I can’t tell the difference between this and other Bud crap.

Another day, another rating.  Beer pours neon urine yellow with tons of carbonation and a better than expected somewhat retained egg white head.  Aroma?  What aroma, you don’t need no stinking aroma!  Very benighn aroma, with just the faintest hint of hops.  Flavor is really not present.  I am really trying here, but I must say that this is one one of the least flavorful beers I have ever had.  Not the foulest, just least flavorful.  NOT again.

Not bad for a budweiser, I like this better than the standard bud bottle, it has a suprisingly decent taste. I wouldn’t go out of my way to buy it but if there is nothing else available it will do. kinda cool looking design too.

I’m not a Bud fan, but today this was cheaper than HighLlife and Coors (my normal cheap beers.)

 It’s kind of interesting though. It tastes better than any other A-B beer. After I am done though, I really don’t taste anything. 

Seems like a good beer for just getting drunk or for hot summer days.

Doesn’t really taste bad or good, but I guess that has its place.
Better than Bud (bolder), but not as good as most other beers that I enjoy.  The price is what pushes this into my upper echelon of beers that I can have at bars.

It’s hard for me to rate this beer.  It’s not in any way offensive like so many others I’ve had.  In fact, if you’re thirsty, it’s really not bad at all.  Basically it’s mildly hoppy, carbonated water.  Could be worse.

id have to say after tasting other budweiser labeled beers, this was definitely the best. first the +’s decent smell, although barely noticeable and actually decent flavor, now the -’s appearance almost waterlike, very thin and watery.it is drinkable, and would be a better beer if it was for those with a  light beer preference.

This is the king of American macro. Anheuser Bush produces the least crappy beer out of the Trifecta, and this is the top brew AB makes. I know it’s gimmicky, but on tap, it’s a bargain compared to anything else you get in the macro price range. Drinking cheap at the bar is pleasurable now. Also, the low amount of rendered sugar is easy on the noggin after sucking down multiple Selects. Hats off for AB some very drinkable low-end beer!
I gotta say, this has to be Budweiser’s best beer.  A little better balance than the traditional.  Otherwise its as BUD as BUD gets.
Pale, pale yellow with heavy carbonation.  Minimal taste with an almost metallic finish to it.  I guess the best thing you can say about it is that it’s about as refreshing as a glass of water.
Nothing special about this...tastes 1000 times better than budweiser...tastes about the same as bud light....wait..is this bud light...lol....

Selected from what?  Tried after a G.I. Summertime, which is a light but excellent beer and this stuff was not even in the same solar system.  Personally I think they are trying to get the macro drinkers to think they are drinking a quasi-micro beer by marketing the "select" name.  Bland.
Brewery @ Jax, FL--I had this at the end of the brewery tour--unimpressed.  Thin, watery nothing to it.
Fizzy yellow beer that’s about as enjoyable as carbonated water can be.  No thanks.

Was handed this at a BBQ and figured I’d take one for the team. Honestly I think this stuff is worse than Busch and if you know me then you know my views on that crap. It was bright yellow with a little lacing head. Flavor was non existent as the beer just had nothing going for it. I gave it a 2 in aroma only because it didn’t smell like water. But it sure tasted watered down. Next time I’ll stay away.

12 oz bottle - Pours almost see thru yellow pale just like it tastes.  Next time I’ll save myself the trouble and throw away the beer and lick the cardboard six holder... I’m sure it would taste better.

Pairs well with oscar mayer bologna, kraft singles, wonder bread, french’s mustard a stack of plain pringles, twinkies, and several other mass-produced flavorless garbage that only appeals to children and people with no tastebuds. Seriously, how much flavor can you remove from beer and still refer to it as beer?

Tried this at the brewery, so it was nice and fresh.  Yea, that didn’t help this horrible swill.  Better then regular Bud, but that’s like saying it’s better to get shot in the head and die then burn alive.  Either way, your dead, and either way with Bud, it’s bad!

Almost artifical head, could make a comment but won’t, Smells sort of like regular Budwieser.  Heck I know this is a Low carb beer and they are usually piss water, but I think I likw this better than Bud Light.  Really carbonated too I can feel the bubbles at the back of my throat.

From the bottle into a room temperature pilsner type glass. I am very impressed. The head stayed up for what seemed like days... then the first swig reminded me of the first day of spring... very refreshing, crisp, airy. I usually don’t drink Bud because of the headache thing... and Bud Light has a really nasty after-taste... but I will be definately be dipping into this stuff... and already acquired my first 20 pack... which was gone through in a couple of hours. No headache, no nasty after taste... Anheiser Bush needs to be recognized! They finally brought the King of Beers to light!

So I guess you could say this smells like beer. Nothing notable about it. The appearance is plain and golden like most macros. The flavor is notable in that it doesn’t have any. Well it’s sort of sweet I guess. Very very very plain beer.

Draft in a frosted mug: poured light yellow with a smallish white head. Little aroma. Flavor was quite light which left me wondering why this is called "Select". Kind of reminds me of Michelob Ultra. Crisp, clean, refreshing but not much flavor especially when served at these near freezing temperatures.

After coming in from a long motorcycle ride, the Select was a surprisingly refreshing beer.  Very pale yellow straw color with a foamy white head and a faintly corny nose.  It is very crisp and clean like the label says, but that is mostly because there is not much here.  Some corn sugar sweetness, thin grain flavors and a little metallic something in the finish.  Must be drank while very cold.  It will quench your thirst.  While this is not very interesting it was unoffensive.

I had this beer in the bottle, yet it smelled as if it were from a can.  The taste was metalic as well.  It looks a lil darker than the popular lite beers.  It really isnt that bad tasting.  Much better than the average popular lite beer.

Great attempt at replicating MGD light.  Not sure I see the point in this, but great attempt anyway.
Decent macro - clean - washes down whatever slop you are eating, but then so does water.
Certainly would not drink for the flavor, or any other characteristics.  Pretty much one of those beers that is just drunk because it is there and so are you, and you want to either get a buzz and/or hold something cold in you hand for a while so you don’t have to put your hands in your pockets and look like a putz.

Pale gold color, soapy white head. Very mild aroma, are those hops? Maybe. Whats there isn’t all that bad. You do actually get some sort of beer flavor without any off flavors. Clean malt. Again, very mild. Thinner bodied, but I’ve had more watery. Better than their regular line of beer.

Like the CHevrolet Cavalier of beers: not bad, not especially good, but something a lot of people can accept. No flavor whatsoever, so it is hard to say it is terrible, but it really doesn’t even seem like beer. I guess it is supposed to be a Bud’s answer to Miller Lite, being low-carb and all, but it reminds me of girly beers like Michelob Ultra, Aspen Edge, etc.....

Pours pale gold, not straw.  No head.  Aroma of some spicy hops and the infamous acetaldehyde green apples.  Interestingly this reminds me of Bud Dry which also features a more pronounced level of that ester.  Malts are clean, very little sweetness.  Hops are somewhat more pronounced than normal Budweiser.  Acetaldehyde gradually disappears, probably due to adaptation.  If you pretend, this is not a bad helles.  I expect this to win in its respective category this fall at GABF.
Couldn’t really tell the difference between this and bud light.  Therefore, it’s not that bad for a light beer.  I was expecting it to have like less alcohol content than bud light but it has more.

Bottled. Oh, fer cry-eye. I really tried to be objective with this, but starting with a bigger yeasty smell than the stalest Berghoff is not a good `introduction/ Pours a foamy head over a very pale body. I sure did not expect it to taste... moldy, that’s the only way to describe it. No other taste to speak of.

Light gold with a diminishing white head.  Little carbonation, less flavor.  Glad the knuckleheads at A-B decided to raise expectations with the "select" brew.  Thank God I know how many calories are in this thing.  Aroma of gym socks.  Taste betrays the slightest hint of alcohol -- the only beer-tasting element I can detect.

From a marketing view I wasn’t sure what this was. A repleacement for the "premium" Anheuser World Select? But they also decide to hid ethe fact that it’s a low carb beer. Big secret once you taste it. Pale straw appearance, moderate foam, light carbonation. Sour fruit, grainy aroma. Very light flavor, minimal, light sourness in the finish. Pretty much a nothing beer, but why don’t they market it as low carb?

This one is a crystal clear, very pale gold with a a nice-sized light foam head that has a surprising bit of staying power. The head actually verges on impressive. The aroma is slight straw and a faint grassiness. The flavor is extremely small. And that no aftertaste they’re talking about is not a lie. The flavor, already tiny, stops abruptly. In fact, it stops so abruptly that it was actually a shock right after the first swallow. Until it’s yanked rudely from the taste buds the flavor is a faint, watery memory of marshmallows.

I think for a low-carb beer this one may have sacrificed the least from the original (although I’ll take a Miller Lite over this).  Its produced for the masses and the chicks on the atkins diet not wanting carbs.
What can you say about a macro-gimmick beer?  Although tis better than the beer snobs on this site would ever give it credit for.

Smells and looks like your regular bad Bud beer. However, this is the "low-carb" version.  Amazingly, this actually manages to sacrifice some taste to accomplish this.  Yes, it is difficult for that to be possible, since Bud is so terrible to begin with, with they did it! The high overall score I gave it was due to its "healthiness".

Finally a beer I can compare to Coors Light.  After my golfing buddy gave me this one I kept having visions of slamming a drive right down his mouth so that I could dislodge the taste buds that he used to make the decision to buy this fermented sugar water.  Pure, vile filth in a bottle.

It has a over carbonated head that fizzled fast into a pale amber colored pour.  Watery beer refreshment, but lacking that oak taste of regular Bud.
Still wondering what the select is.
Got this free today, truly one of the most bland beers, I’ve ever tasted.It kind of sizzled on my tongue too, but not in a good way.  I’ve had worse, but not many.
Watered-down and little taste.  When you think beer can’t get any lighter you get Budweiser Select.
Once again, a mass produced watered down beer with no real taste.  The aroma was faint, but skunky.  Very pale yellow with quickly deminshing head.   The taste truly reminded me of an O’Douls.

Pale yellow liquid with a tall ultra white foamy head. Dry grainy aroma, with hints of floral hops and rice wine vinegar. Sweet start, with hints of malt liquor. Middle has some grain and mild white wine flavors. Spritzy, watery feel. Real ice brew finish, which means that there is little left to show what you drinking for. I think if you mix water, light beer and a white wine cooler, you get this.

12 oz bottle.  Just remembered I had this about 2 weeks ago.
It was WATER.  There was absolutely nothing to it.  The person who handed the bottle to me said "this has no taste"
and they were right.  Abysmal.  

Anheuser Select sucks also.

i got a bottle free from my neighbor
i took one sip and then told him
i had to go inside for more smokes.
i promptly poured it in the toilet where it belonged,grabed a funnel and filled it
with pilsner urquell so as not to offend
him and went back outside.
extremely light on taste on appearence and aroma. For a low cal low carb beer it is so so.

I am amazed. This beer REALLY does taste like air. I mean nothing. Tonic water. There is not even bad taste to rip on. Just nothing. 

On a follow up, I have discovered an excellant use for this beer. Its great for washing out the mouth while tasting different beers. I’m dead serious. Take five gulps between beers and the palate is clean. I did this and drank a Petes Wicked Rally Cap Ale and realized how terrible that beer is as well.

I’ve had water that had more body, character, and flavor than this. This is light beer gone insane. ZERO flavor. ZERO taste.
Even air has a taste to it. How did Anheuser-Busch  come up with something that the human taste buds could not detect, and more importantly WHY the hell did they come up with something that the human taste buds can not detect?? Given it’s  below average  4.3% by volume it’s not even worthy as an alcohol delivery system.
Do yourself a favor: instead of trying this, drink a glass of tap water, then spin around in a circle 10 times. You’ll get more flavor, a better buzz, and save big bucks!

Can. My buddy Neil brought this over today, knowing I hadn’t tried it and knowing I would never pay money for it. I can summarize my views of this beer in a few short words: Anheuser Busch should be embarassed to put their name on this beer. It is so bland and innocuous that it simply doesn’t taste anything like beer. Bland lager aroma. Pale yellow, clear body with a diminishing head. Totally devoid of flavor. No malty sweetness. Biscuit. Lifeless.

Bottled at Coaches in Philly, PA.
Nothing going on here. It’s a light shade of yellow. Didn’t have that Bud taste. I guess that’s a plus.
I really dont know what to think about this.  It’s a bunch of nothingness. It reminds me of water. I think this is even lighter than Bud Light.  I usually like my beer to taste more like... beer.
Nothing here at all.  No real flavor or any aroma.  For being a new beer they didn’t really put much effort into this.

Pours a one-finger white froth from the bottle being straight up, this fades quickly and there is no lace.  Clear very pale amber color.  Nose is not there for me, at least it is not skunky like so many from the macros.  Light carbonation and very light bodied.  Starts with a slight sweetness no detectable hops, watery finish.  I would rather drink water than spend money on this "beer".  $1.25 for a 12oz bottle from Colonial Spirits, Acton, Ma.

Light citrus/lemony flavor and extremely watery.  This really needs more beer added - more malt, more ANYTHING!!!  I would imagine most people would find this far too light and flavorless.  In its favor, it seems really fresh.  Freshly watery with a minerally, Evianesque quality.

Draft at Sea World (San Diego) - Golden yellow in color... slightly darker than regular Bud.  Aroma was the familiar Bud.  Flavor was slightly more sweet than Bud.  Not much more than "select" Bud"...

Bottled 12Feb05:  Clear golden urine colour, with a fluffy sticky white head.  Aroma of dirty toilet water, vegetables, corny syrup, papery wet cardboard.  Thank goodness I wasnt expecting anything nice here, because this doesnt taste like anything, except for cardboard, and wet paper, and diapers.  People swear by this stuff at the store I work at...I just want to swear at it.  This is quite terrible and lacking in every department, except for sucking.  Thanks AB for another beer for me to flush down the toilet.

This is different for Budweiser I guess. Not too much of a difference in flavor. Perhaps a little more fruity. At least they steared away from green bottles, unlike the World Select. I guess it should be rated only slightly higher than that beer because it isn’t skunked.
I think that this is regular Budweiser under a funky label, tastes like it too.

i honestly can say i saw no difference in this and regular budweiser.  i took the brewery tour (had to, a friend was in town visiting). very thin, wasn’t skunked....that may be the best thing i can say about it. clean, as its supposed to be. other than that..just mildly sweet, boring, simple and an all around waste of my time.
Tastes like regular Bud. Amazing. I’m surprised the conception of this brew didn’t stop the Earth from spinning on it’s axis or earthquakes and volcanoes, or the dead being risen form their graves.

If anybody remembers back when it was the rage to caffinate water then they will realize that the scientists at A-B have done something amazing. They have managed to pack all the alcohol of Bud into water, or atleast something that tastes like water. This stuff is really that flavorless.

Light yellow and very clear. Bubbly white head actually had some lasting power, with some residual lace even! First time I’ve ever said that about an A-B product. Graham cracker nose. Soft, light, thin and watery texture. Very light malt notes of bread, crackers and hard taco shells. Herbal bitterness is very mild. Curious notes of minerals in the aftertaste; kind of odd. Far from decent, but it was much cleaner and less plagued with off-flavors than other macro products I can think of ... that said, it’s a pretty flavorless beer.

Bottle:  Virtually no aroma, maybe a touch of grassy malt.  Pours an extremely pale transparent yellow with a soapy white head the diminishes quickly.  This would get a 1 in appearance if I hadn’t seen Labatt Blue Light.  This looks better so I’ll give it a 2.  Almost no flavor.  Again maybe some very light sweetness and a touch of almost non-existant hops in the finish.  No real suprises here.  Pretty much what you expect from Budweiser.

12 oz can:  Urine yellow w/ a lasting white head.  Typical macro swill, hints of grainy malt, clean, blah, blah, blah!  Why they would make this when they have Mich Ultra I have no idea!  Canned water!
wow.. so budweiser made something w/ less flavor than bud light.. I guess it’s unoffensive.. I probably would have liked it in college.
Won’t you take me too......Skunky town....Won’t you take me too.....skunky town.
Very bad beer for a very bad concept.  This beer both smells and tastes like water.  No taste whatsoever.  Just say no to these lo-carb beers.

12oz bottle cold. I can’t say I was disappointed since I didn’t have my hopes up too high. Looks, smells, and tastes pretty much like a regular Bud so if your looking for a low carb, low calorie version of Bud this is your beer. Of course its metallic, sweet, watered down and has a corn like taste but if you like Bud then you already know this. For everyone else this beer is far from select.

Bottle... Much like having sex in a canoe, this is fucking way too close to water! Ok, ok... clear, straw-colored beer with a large, frothy, white head. Terrific retention and semi-cool lacing, but who really cares in this case? Smells like canned corn and white pepper. Tastes like seltzer water, but manages to deliver an unfortunate whisper of sugary sweetness. Ultra light-bodied and fizzy. Short, lightly sweet finish. Avoid this one at all costs... unless you’re diabetic and desperate to get your hands on a low carb beer... and this is your only choice.

I don’t get the marketing of ths one. We have upscale packaging and naming of a *low-carb* or *light* beer. I was expecting something more substantial than regular bud, but this is even more watery and bland. Flavor is rice and corn, can’t find much in the way of hops balance. Oh well, america will be fooled and buy it in truckloads.

This beer is not good.  It has a lot of carbonation and almost no taste. It’s pretty much a miserable experience.  Don’t drink it.  They don’t need more money to make more crappy beer.  Please stop supporting them.

Aroma is a light malty vanilla and really isn’t that bad. Has the same weak pee color and headlessness of regular Bud but with less carbonation. Flavor is gritty and raunchy. Horrible thin mouthfeel seals the fate of this beer as a drainpour in my book!

Ahhh.  Pours like soapy water.  Tons of suds that cover an unbelievably light and transparent liquid... some say there might be beer in there.  Aroma is hard to find.  Taste is also minimal.  If you really have to have a light AB product, try Bud Lite... it is about the same with a hint of taste.  This time it is out of a 24 oz can... not recommended.  I remember it having some semblence of taste coming from a bottle that a buddy gave me a while back...

Let me just say that I got this for free when I had been sitting in a country bar for almost two hours, and a waitress offered it to me. Tastes like regular Bud, only a little sweeter/maltier and has a funny herbal type character to it. Still sucks!
Very light color with a white head.  Decent lacing.  A bit of malt and hops in the aroma.  Light body with a quick finish.  Reminds me of the A-B beers that I drank 25 years ago.

This stuff...remember Bud Dry...This is the same stuff, like Bud Light with more...mmm...nothingness to it.  Why does AB sell so much beer?  God, what a shame...I could have bought a half rack of Rainier for what I paid for this crap...And not had the Anheuser Busch headache to boot...

Man, when they say it finishes clean they weren’t kidding.  There is almost no taste at all, which is a good thing because in this case taste would mean cheap swill taste.  One of the more inoffensive swills.
this is a terrible beer just like all the other light low carb garbage it was about time AB joined the fun and started making more disgusting crap

This was basically a bad version of Bud Light.  I know I’ll catch crap for this but, I drink Bud Light when I’m out.  We don’t have any good pubs around here so you are kind of stuck.  I won’t be getting this again!

The beer poured semi flat - lacking the carbonation of its little bother (Bud Shite).  Minimal head, somewhat sour aroma, but surprisingly clean on  the palate.  Better than many light beers (Bud, Coors, Miller), but not a real alternative to a full bodied lager.  Keep trying Anheuser Busch.

Well, I have to say ... it wasn’t as bad as I feared it would be. Poured a clear yellow with a thick, fizzy white head from a 16 oz. metal bottle ... it’s like some cross between a can and a bottle. Perhaps it’s a cottle ... or a ban. No matter. Aroma is like regular Bud, only a tad less so ... sweet corn, malt, a touch of yeastiness. Flavor is sweet malt and adjunct-rich ... thin bodied, highly-carbonated mouthfeel. For a low-cal, low-carb beer, it’s not so bad. It’s still barely beer, though.

Clear, extremely pale yellow color with a large fluffy white head. Very faint corn and lager aroma. Light pepper, corn, and yeast flavors that fade very quickly. Crisp feel with a smei-dry finish. Not as terrible as regular Bud.

Boring yellow color with a small white head. The aroma still has the nasty vomit character as the regular budweiser...corn and some sweet bread as well. The flavor did not have the vomit thing (that’s a plus!), but included plenty of sweet corn, bread, and somewhat stale hops tones in the aftertaste. The feel was fizzy and watery with a semi-dry finish. This is almost EXACTLY like the regular Bud.

On tap at Dudley’s Draw, College Station, TX.  Pours a poor yellow color with little head.  Taste is almost similar to Bud Light, but less revolting.  Actually detected a slight hops presence in this brew.   Not terrible, and much better than Budweiser or Bud Light... not that I’m gonna  buy this again any time soon.

Thanks a million to Joe for sending me a bottle of this highly popular brew: Clean straw hue with a fizzy head and no lace. The aroma has a touch of lemongrass, toasted malt, and vegetables. The taste is bland and boring with lightly citric and bitter notes than fade before you knew them. A corny aftertaste. The feel, what feel other than carbonated water. Argggh, yet another swill for the masses whom think it some kind of special beer for being "select".

it could be worse.  this is really tasteless.. reminds me alot of water. so at least you can chug it down. but if i was goign to drink an AB product it would be regular bud.. i just bought this to try it out and hell it was only 4.50 for a six pack.
Bought a 12 pack after seeing o many commercials isn’t bad can drink a lot of it but i am not to fond of the sweetness and it taste just like bud light to me

Similar to O’Doul’s in potency. A soapy soft-drink style fizz, sort of like a seltzer water. It really brought out the aluminum flavor of the can. You have to really dig to find any flavor. I think it has a sourness...I suppose if you let it sit in your mouth long enough, your saliva would break down the rice enough to make it sweeter.
Wow, mainstream beer is tasting less and less like beer.  This resembles a lightly sweetened carbonated water.
Straw in color with a small white head that quickly disapates. Light grain aroma,very clean. Clean dry flavor with no aftertaste.

Yellow, light foamy head. Some lace. Some citrus in the nose.. mostly corn. A touch bitter in the flavors with more adjuncts coming out. Slightly metallic. Medium body with a decent malt finish. Not bad.. but nothing too great.

Had this bottled.  Certainly not the worst beer I’ve ever had, and perhaps the best of the Budweiser line.  Pale, bubbly pour, watery head, watery mouthfeel, plane jane beer.  Perhaps the best of the decidedly "low carb" beers.

24oz. can. Pours a pale golden color. Aroma is malty and grainy. Very watery. Not offensive at all, just very watery. Might be good on a 100 plus degree day. Although this beer is nothing special, I would take this over any other BMC light beer anyday.
Somewhat faint malt aroma.  Beer has a watery flavor of sesame seeds.  MOuthfeel is very watery.  no finish of note
Watery, low carb beers suck. You want to worry about your waistline? Go to the gym and sweat it out. Drinking crappy beer won’t help you out.
Best of the ever growing population of low carb beers, but that isnt saying much.
The most beautiful bartender on the Southside of Chicago handed me one of these saying,  "I got this one."  That’s my excuse, and I’m freakin’ sticking with it.
I think this is much better then a lot of macros I’ve tried.  It’s not over carbonated with a huge plus, and it has some light fruit and malt taste.
Iwas looking kinda forward to this stuff.  Ihad Miller Lite before hand and this tasted like water compared to this crap.

If you want a beer that tastes like nothing this is the one for you.  No aroma (not even the budweiser bannana ester), thin body, and little bitterness.  It is beer for people who do not like beer.  I think that is the point of this beer though. Refreshing, yes but I can think of at least a dozen other beers that are refreshing that I would rather drink.

All my thoughts about this beer came through when i finally bought it. the color was decent, foamy head, and very little aftertaste, so i can drink more of it. the one downfall, however, is that it must be very cold when you drink it, otherwise you get that nasty metal taste. oh yeah, and i wish they put more alcohol in it. other than those 2 things, it’s a decent beer. For 11.88/case plus tax and deposit, a beer worth drinking, in my book.

Light golden; minimal head.  Aroma lightly sugary.  They shoudl change the "No aftertaste" slogan to "No taste," because this beer tastes like water.  Thin mouthfeel, but clean.  Regular Bud is :better," if barely distinguishable.
Wait a minute...this is Bud Light in a different bottle.  Shame on Anheuser-Busch for falsely marketing this crap as a special beer.

Pour is yellow and fizzy with minimal head...no real discernable smell, something grainy...tasted surprisingly palatable...not good, but palatable...corn and grain was definately in there though...finish was non existent...zero...definately the best AB product I’ve had so far...

I thought this beer was pretty refreshing.  Sure, no nose, very little flavor (I did get some bananna esters), but on a hot day, I would drink this before I drank some sugary soda.  I’m not one of those raters that will bash every beer AB put out.  This beer fits into it’s niche quite nicely.  Is it a work of art? No, but I don’t mind that.
I like this better than some bmc beers, only because it doesn’t taste bad.  However, if over-carbonated water isn’t your thing you may not want to try this.

What in the hell is this crap?  "Select"?  Is friggin’ light beer in disguise!  They fool you into thinking that this might be a "premium" AB beer, but no...  It’s Bud’s version of Mich Ultra.  Crap!  Can you believe that Budweiser "Select" is getting worse ratings than regular Bud?  I can.  Try it and you’ll believe.  Who are these clowns at AB?  The place must be run by fizzy-beer-swiggin’-yuppies or something.

Gold Coloring with Small Carbonated Head.  Little if Any Aroma.  Immediate Notes of Corn, Grain and Hops...Just as it Reaches the Threshold of Skunkiness...It Drops Completely Flat. No Taste, No Aftertaste... For a Drinkable Swill Beer, This Is Budweiser’s Best Offering So Far.

Again I quote "Beer For Dummies" on aftertaste: "Imagine dining on succulent Maine lobster dipped in pure drawn butter, only to have the flavor disappear from your mouth as soon as you swallow...." Aftertaste is not a bad thing, but when you make beers that taste as bad as the ones AB makes, maybe the lack of aftertaste isn’t such a bad thing. More foo foo piss corn rice crap.

Can.  Goes down smooth.  Lacks flavor.  Lacks bite.  Has no aftertaste.  You really get left hanging.  Probably excellent for shotgunning with the bros at the frat house.  However, that’s not my scene.
Very pale yellow body with little head and some lacing.  It’s slightly sweet and malty with a sweet corn note.  very light bodied, watery, smooth and slightly dry.
This sucked, I dont know what they were trying to accomplish with this beer, but they didnt do a good job

Crystal clear and still yellow beer with the standard quickly fizzy head.  No aroma whatsoever, and only a light cornstarchy "flavor".  I think they made this to compete with the even worse Michelob Ultra.  It’s just as bad, so I guess they met their goal.

The two redeeming qualities of this beer were: a.) I got the 12 pack for free from a co-worker; and b.) I now have 11 beers to offer un-important houseguests. I could not get far past its unpleasant aroma, reminiscent of bad-breath. Color seemed to be that of ginger ale as I poured it into the sink.
This was not all that bad but there really was no aftertaste and it is priced higher than other beers in the same category.

12 oz bottle, Sultans of Swill tasting with tiggmtl and ClarkVV 5.  We took the challenge:  to drink, to describe, to rate the very worst beers in the world.  We did not limit our search to just America, home of PBR and Natty Light...no, we searched far and wide, looked high and low, from the North country of Ontario to the beaches of Antigua.  But in the end, after cascades of foul cardboard, aluminum, asparagus and chemicals, it was there in our own back yard:  yes, though I for one did not believe it, good ol’ American A-B came through for us and delivered this, the crowning glory of their empire, a beverage so plasticine, so artificial, so cottony and redolent of the cheapest microwaved vegetables, that it not only one our tasting, but it won my heart.  This, I proclaim, sets the new standard...the Worst of the Worst, King of Swill, the most Offensive Beer in the World!  Congratulations, now where’s the toilet?

Strong vegetal aroma.  Clear pale colour with thin, white, fully-diminishing head.  Plastic flavour is subsumed by vegetable DMS.  Very dry.  Watery. Low carbonation.  Unpleasant in the extreme.  Bottle sampled with ClarkVV and muzzlehatch.

I assumed by the name this should have been better than normal Bud - I didn’t realize this was their low carb offering.  I could tell however, as soon as I tasted it.  Very similar to the other low carb stuff out there ie: Mic Ultra.  Doesn’t taste ’bad’ - doesn’t taste ’good’ - doesn’t taste much of anything.

Swill tasting with Tiggmtl and Muzzlehatch.  It’s been a while since I’ve had either bud or bud lite, but man, I don’t remember either of those being this bad (though they are pretty awful).  This was a fresh six pack I picked up that was kept in a cooler, so I don’t know what the problem is.  Oh wait, maybe the problem is that the beer is made poorly, so it dosent matter how it’s kept.  Another one of those pale lagers that goes past the point of being bland and actually (highly) offends the palate.  Stale cardboard and sickly corn-syrup with tons of stinging carbonation.  Extremely light yellowish-clear body with little to no head.  Aroma of corn syrup and cereal grains.  Just a huge pervasive stale apples and papery, dirty cardboard.  Possibly a recreation of World Select, but I don’t even remember that being as bad as this is.
Is this a bud light light??  Taste like club soda.  Looks like any american lager on the market.  Thank God my buddy will buy fu fu mess like this so i dont have to waste my money on it.
Looks and taste like bud light.  A little richer flavor than ultra.  Not what I want in a beer.

Just saw this at the store on sale cheap and I just had to try it.  Suprised it actually poured a small head tjhat stuck around.  There is no smell at all except blandness.  The color is typical macro gold.  It tastes like that got some left over  Mich Ultra and put it in a Select bottle.  I am not a fan of AB products and sadly this has not changed my opinion.
not sure if this is better than bud lite, more of a bud taste, if that is good, metal after taste.

Bottle. Thin straw colored body with a loose film of bubbles for a head. Smells like sewage. There are the usual Bud flavors-cardboard, clay, some light citrus. There is a very noticable metallic aftertaste that is killing me. It tastes like blood. This lies somewher in between Bud and Bud light. It is bland crap, but with the metal flavor, it is bland crap that tastes as if the secret ingredient in it is tin foil.  Sadly, I have had worse.

Ok new beer from the "Evil Empire"..lets see ..
Appearance ..well the usual urine colour of someone slightly dehydrated from a night on the town...no head..just spittle like lace.
Smell..of rice pudding not beer.
Taste? tastes like seltzer water ,with rice and cardboard.
mouthfeel is miserable..limp and rotten finishes with a wimper.
No waywould I buy more of this..usual low carb crap. Doesnt A-B know the low carb frenzy is almost over. I dont see the point in this beer they alreadyhave the abysmal Mich.Ultra..drank everywere by obese idiots with their plate of grease.
no taste no nose  no character no anything. water is more complex and tastes better.
just got done drinking a 22 0z. of this horse piss.....have those bud people gone nucking futs or what......has the worst metallic aftertase .....dont waste your money on this
Next to nothing.  Pithy, bland aroma.  Not distasteful, but woefully bland.  It’s like Bud without hops.

Wow,  Bud’s answer to Michelob’s successful Ultra. If you are a healthnut or are watching you’re calories, then now you have another choice besides Ultra & Aspen. But I find of the three, this is the worst.

I don’t see the point to A-B making this "beer."  It’s just Bud’s weakest sister.  Ugly urine yellow with a sweaty armpit stench, this has a sweet corn flavor and is virtually hopless.  And hopeless.  At least the sweet metallic finish is pretty weak.

Bottle: Thanks to the locals at the Grey Lodge for sending this one over as a joke....guess they thought I wouldn’t rate it.  Pours like water with pale yellow food coloring.  Aroma is mild grass (hops!).  Flavor is sweet grains, corn, light hops.  Quite honestly this was better than I expected, and you really can get just a hint of hops here.

I didn’t know what this was when I bought it, but when I drank it, I thought, "hmmm bud light light". Now it is apparent that this is competition to Miller Lite. Not much to say, just thin, carbonated, and light in color and flavor. Drinkable, just not too good.
Hard to describe something with no flavor to rate. I guess this is their competition with miller lite.

Decent pale golden color,small white head that faded quickly leaving little behind.The aroma was faintly malty with a bit of hops in the background,and fairly decently carbonated.The taste was another thing all together.Watery thin malt some adjuncts and just a very faint hint of hops in the end and the only thing really happening in this beer is the Carbonation which helps the beer keep going but to where i no not.if you can find a single of this it’s worth trying atleast once but if you have to buy more then that i’d wait until someone else buys it then mooch one off of them.

Bottle.  What a fucking joke.  Is this Bud’s attempt at the South beach beer
drinker?  Pale, tasteless, and Just downright nasty.  I thought it was just a new 
marketing scheme for bud until I asked a friend.  Pisses me off.

I could try to think up something witty about this to describe it but it’s really not even worth it. It’s watery, pale and full of rice nose and flavor, less of a finish than drinking water. The rice is all that jumps up. If it weren’t for the carbonation and the watery finish I’d think this was watered down geikkekan.

After drinking and writing notes on 24 beers (hit up the Sly Fox then Victory then the Philly Gathering), what better way than to end it with this? Very weak aromas and tastes. Lightly sweet. Watery body.

One of the regulars at my local watering hole works for a Budweiser distributor.    He was given a free six pack and brought it down the bar for light beer drinkers to sample.   Two weeks later there was still two bottles left.   Nobody wanted to try it.  Not even for free.  Popping the cap the beer gave off the aroma of a wet rag.    Slight lacing of the glass during the sample.    Chemical taste and a sweet finish.  I’d rather have a cider or even a B to the E over Bud Select.

Poured yellow with a decent head.
Aroma and flavor of corn with a metalic taste on the palate.
Average beer with not much flavor.
Whatever.
some ass brought this into my home. after watchig him drink six  of these i had to try one. just as i thought nasty. supprised they call this beer.

I guess Michelob Ultra’s appeal is dying. But then again I thought the Atkins low carb fad was losing steam as well. Well it the midst of it all here comes this. I thought Bud Light was THIS. Well on to the beer. Trasparent yellow color with a cooked corn smell. It has no flavor whatsoever. It tastes like water. Maybe a little better than bud light, maybe?

Average is about the best word I can use to describe this beer. I am such a sucker for new beers and when I saw it on sale I had to buy it. The flavor is crisp & leaves little or no after-taste. If Budweiser is going to market this as a Low-Carb Beer they may have nailed it as it is better than any other. I would order this beer at a bar as it is easy to drink & does have a smooth flavor.

What’s a day without a little AB bashing.  I walked into the Class VI store on base Friday and the manager said, "I’ve got a new one...it’s great...better than Miller or Coors lite..".  Ok, I think I’d be impressed.  My buddy was so he bought a sixer.  So how does the new AB lager fair.......surprise!!---it stinks.  Good Lord folks, some people just don’t get it.  How could anyone who taste tested this for AB prior to its release say it was anything other than bland, listless, and otherwise poor?  I know by definition you don’t have to have hops to make beer, but gee whiz they could’ve thrown in a little.  What a sad state the King of Beers has sunk to....and I don’t mean Mizzou.

I just couldn’t bear to drink a whole bottle of this, so I ordered one and split it with my friend Jeff (okay, maybe I should now start referring to him as my EX-friend!).  Look at the bottle and marketing they use - all of the dark brown colors, it came as quite a surprise (well maybe not) that this poured into our glasses a pale pale pale yellow, no head, no lacing.  Aroma is cereal and very light.  Body - very fizzy - full of tiny little prickly bubbles.  Despite the lack of taste and body, iit managed to leave a sticky chemical film on my tongue.  Oh, and now I see that this is their lo-carb beer - what a waste of a pretty brown bottle.
The add campaign for Bud Light being "Low Carb" must have been failing, but doesn’t AB get the profits from Mich Ultra anyways?  I guess they wanted a little bit more.

From a bottle. The aroma is corn some light white bread. The taste is metallic with light and watered down cornflakes. Finishes sweet. I had this again on tap. Same taste, but I got really tired of it after a few glasses. Not really any better than the standard corn and rice affair.

Well.  It’s not spectacular, but it suits the criteria that they set up for it.  Very little aftertaste, very smooth, but almost to the point of being tasteless.  As far as cheap generic beers go, it’s alright, but no one’s going to opt for it over an actual good beer.
